results.description:
The NY AdTech meetup puts on next generation advertising technology focused meetup events for buy-side and sell-side advertising technologists working at the nexus of advertising, technology, data, new media, and innovation. The meetup focuses on those advertising and technology innovations that are changing everything about the what and the how and even the why of advertising, advertising markets and advertising operations. Among the topics on the agenda for this meetup are ad exchanges, behavioral targeting, campaign management automation, demand side platforms, audience relationship management, audience buying, yield management, supply side platforms, IPTV and online video, addressable TV, data and analytics appliances, data mining, and machine learning, data exchanges, audience insight, computational advertising, social media listening platforms, social media data mining, RFID, digital outdoor display, digital in-store, locative marketing, mobile advertising platforms, hypertargeting, behavioral targeting, re-targeting, media buying optimization, ad servers, next generation TV platforms, privacy, bid management systems, semantic advertising, low-latency, automated decisioning, next generation portable media devices, 3D digital outdoor...Hopefully this gives you an idea of what this meetup is about and equal what isn't. If you are working in or interested in the melting point that is the intersection of technology and advertising you should get along on this meetup.

The Ad Technologist meetup is all about making connections; connecting people, connecting ideas, connecting knowledge and insights, connecting the dots, and most of all making the connection between technology and innovation and advertising to best connect with the people we as advertisers seek to connect with.
results.name: NY AdTech

results.description: The NYC Bio Meetup is sponsored by NYC Bio - a not-for-profit organization established to facilitate collaboration, innovation and entrepreneurship in the NYC community.  Our goal is to build and sustain a thriving NYC biotech cluster encompassing biotech, nanotech, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, environmental technology and information technology with biological applications.  Come hear presentations, ask questions, share real life experiences, and network with bio enthusiasts and entrepreneurs from NYC's business, finance, academic and medical communities.
results.name: NYC Bio Meetup

results.description:
This meetup is for pilots interested in flying new class of Light Sports aircrafts (LSAs).  

As a community of pilots, we aim to increase awareness and interest in LSAs, and foster shared ownership at low cost through formation of fractionals, partnerships and flying clubs in the region.

LSAs provide an affordable way to fly brand new planes, with new engines, modern avionics @ 120 kts (138 miles/hr) of cruise speed. Cost of insurance is usually low and maintenance much lower than older aircrafts.

New pilots need only 20 hrs of training to learn to fly LSAs. Private pilots can fly VFR @ Night and even IFR for properly equipped planes. If you are  not sure about renewing your medical, you can continue to fly LSAs with a regular drivers license.

So please come join us to know about future of aviation and meet other current and prospective LSA enthusiasts and pilots.
results.name: The NY/NJ/CT Light Sports Pilot Group

results.description: This Meetup is devoted to serving the intersection of real estate and technology. Web 2.0 technology has changed several industries, but how has it affected our ability to collaborate and create new real estate opportunities? How can we begin to serve the long tail in real estate? What is the role of social networking sites in the sales and acquisitions process? Are there better ways to collaborate with your team on projects? The meet-ups are meant to be social, educational and fun. They range in variety from presentations by real estate technology leaders and project focused working sessions, to architectural pub-crawls and social gatherings. Primary emphasis will be placed on connecting thought leaders and deal makers.
results.name: Real Estate 2.0 NYC

results.description: Hello, anyone interested in sharing conversation over lunch in Chinatown, NYC? I like the cheap, quiet eateries. Note that this isn't a group for free lunch. (Note: I am busy and out of town for a while. Sarina is Assistant Organizer while I am away. If anyone else would like to set up some meetups, let me know)
results.name: The Chinatown Lunch Club

results.description:
Welcome to the meetup site for the Indiezone.tv Local NYC chapter, a group of  filmmakers/actors dedicated to film, music, literature, and the arts, with the goal of creating, inspiring and connecting with people from the independent film and music communities. We will use our connections to introduce filmmakers, actors, and other artists with the intent to grow a more expansive and collaborative creative body that can bestow both inspiration and resources to our chapter.


The next few months of Indiezone.tv Local NYC will consist of meetings, film screenings, and music events. Some events will be free of charge; others will be set up to deliberately show our support for independent film (we cannot say we love independent film if we are not willing to support those films in the box office). Over the next year our goal is to become a cohesive, intelligent, and passionate support system that can be leaned on and circled back to as we start our own creative endeavors.


We are always looking for passionate and talented members to join Indiezone.tv. If this sounds like you, click the JOIN NOW button at the top, and make sure to check out Indiezone.tv to find exclusive interviews, industry news, and information about your favorite artists!


We are always looking for passionate and talented members to join Indiezone.tv. If this sounds like something you would be interested in, click the Join Us at the top of the page.  If this sounds like something you would be interested in, email membership@indiezone.tv to find out more information about our organization and how you can be a part of what we doing.  Make sure to check out Indiezone.tv to find exclusive interviews, industry news, and information about your favorite artists!

Create. Inspire. Connect.
results.name: Indiezone.tv Local NYC

results.description:
Welcome to the NJ Cake Decorators Club!

If you are as crazy about cake decorating as we are, this is the perfect club for you!

This club is for anyone who does cake decorating as a hobby or as a business.

Here you will be able to network, improve your skills, take classes as a group, share recipes and more!

results.description: Meet other lesbians on Long Island, make some new friends. We have events on Long Island like eating out, picnics, movies, house parties, etc... .let me know what you'd like to do. My main purpose is to have some fun and make some friends...
results.name: Long Island Lesbians

results.description:
NJ Friendship Factory is a place to come and meet people through out NJ to spend time together and work on building lasting, meaningful relationships.

We welcome all people who are kind and caring, who really want to make some true connections and share a little part of this journey we call life. Recent face photo required on profile.

We will be hosting all types of events from casual outdoor fun excursions to dinner and a movie.  All ages are welcome here, event organizers may choose to post target age or preference groups for some of the events. Most events will be held within a 20 mile radius of Keyport.

We do hope that you join us and get started on building many great friendships!


With Love, Cassie

There will be no self promoting of businesses or events in this group. If you would like to advertise in my blog for just $35 it goes to 12,000 people in central NJ through my meetup and facebook groups , twitter too via my newsletter at  http://cassiescalendar.blogspot.com/

Charity organizations are FREE please contact me at cassieslnj@gmail.com

#makefriendsinNJ  #socialevents #socialnetworking

results.description:
New Jersey Yoga and Meditation group welcomes those who practice and/or want to learn more about Yoga, Meditation & Breathing techniques to reduce stress and enhance the quality of life.

We offer FREE introductory sessions and workshops, for a charge, that teach Yoga, Meditation & Breathing techniques to reduce stress, detoxify the body, bring clarity of mind, emotional stability and nurture the spirit. We offer programs through the Art of Living Foundation.
The Art of Living Foundation offers programs to uncover the strength, peace, and joy that lie at the core of every human being. By nurturing the spirit and compassion of every individual, the Foundation seeks to help build a global society that is free of stress, violence, and misery - and full of service, wisdom, and celebration. At the heart of the Foundation's work are educational and humanitarian programs that uplift individuals, make a difference in local communities, and foster global change.

The Art of Living Foundation is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) educational and humanitarian organization in the U.S. since 1989. Accredited as a United Nations NGO in 1996, it is now one of the UN's largest volunteer-based NGO.
results.name: New Jersey Yoga and Meditation Group

results.description: Peer group for energy entrepreneurs to share ideas, experiences, and plans: look for best solution to energy crisis, solution could be within Pickens' Plan, Al Gore, or our own, The  presentations will be done in monthly meetings

results.description:
Whether you travel by dragon, X-wing, Floo Powder , Stargate, rabbit hole, DeLorean, magic carpet, TARDIS, Oceanic Airlines…or NYC subway...this meetup is for you.

The purpose of the NY SciFi and Fantasy is to meet other fans and enjoy the culture of these great genres together, usually by watching TV series and movies.

You don’t have to be a huge fan of sci fi and fantasy to come.   You don’t have to be the person who has your DVR permanently set to the Syfy Channel, speak fluent Klingon, or have seen every single dragon movie ever made.   Although you certainly can be.

We are open to all fans—old fans, new fans, sci fi fans, fantasy fans , book fans, movie fans, comic book fans…you name it, and you will likely find someone in our group who shares your interests.  We try to vary themes to cover the spectrum of sci fi and fantasy and introduce others to movies and shows that they may not have been exposed to before.

The NY SciFi & Fantasy Organizers

Note: Joining this meetup group you agree to the rules and regulations set forth in our membership policy.
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy

results.description: This group is for Australian Expats living in New York.  It's a forum to keep up to date with what's happening in the community and, if you choose to attend our events, a chance to make new friends and have a beer.  We also trade advice about taxation, real estate, visa's and many other things via our discussion boards - I would encourage everyone to contribute!

results.description: Escape for awhile in the romance of Beauty and the Beast, the fantasy of Wicked, the comedy of Dirty Rotten Scoundrels...well, you get the point. We are a group designed for those who enjoy seeing a great show, a new band, or the latest comedy act. We will be exploring the theaters of NJ as well as an occasional jaunt to NYC.
results.name: Central Jersey Theater and Performing Arts Enthusiasts

results.description:
You know who you are! The special little dog that seems to rule the city! You are everywhere and you love to get together and play! So we are pleased to announce a new meetup group called "Yorkie Nation". 

Whether you're a Yorkie with papers, or a yorkie whose background is mixed with some other breed, you are welcome to join our group! We'd like to get together and discuss everything Yorkie! 

Let's show our pride and gather the biggest, the brightest, and the most enthusiastic doggy meetup group. 
We will keep you up-to-date on NYC doggy events. We'd love to have huge Yorkie showings at all dog-friendly events! We will host large and small-scale Yorkie outings throughout the year -- everything from brunches, to Yappy hours, to play dates. Socializing your dog is very important for a happy and healthy dog!

Please join us in our Yorkie Nation!
results.name: Yorkie Nation

results.description:
Vegan & Veg kids want to meet & play with others who share the feeling - we're friends of animals on the land, sea, & air. :)

A social and support group for vegan and vegetarian children and their parents living inNew York City. Let's celebrate with get-togethers, holidays, birthday parties and picnics - all veg! Many groups are veg, but don't have many kids or kid-friendly activities. Other groups are kid-friendly, but animal-filled (not in the nice way)!

This special group will help your kids make veg*n friends and mentors and support your veg/vegan parenting. We plan to add other events such as veg*n camping, day trips, play dates, etc. Join us!
results.name: NYC Vegetarian/Vegan Parents & Kids Group

results.description:
Hi New Yorkers and now New Jersey folks :),

This is a group about meeting other people who are interested in a discussion about Anger Management. If you are one of them who think that getting better control over anger can make your days better, this is the group you may want to give a shot.

"I have had anger issues for a considerable number of years and it took away a lot from me. The little mundane details that bothered me then not only hurt me, but those around me as well.

It took me a while to get over these issues and its with some simple practices, I managed to change my life.

Through this group, I hope to spread these methods and convert the negativity and make days a little more beautiful for those who still are in my shoes"

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iJb_bh...

A note to NEW members.

Admitting anger and joining the group is your first step. If you've realised that this is an issue you have..... the next step is to do something about it.

There are three kinds of members we usually see- One, who admit they have anger issues and its affecting their lives but never take the next step to join a meetup. The second category, experiences the power of these methods in an hour and go home. The third category, experience these changes everyday in their mood and in their life because they take these learnings from the meetup and implement everyday and manage to change their perceptions of how they CAN control their life everyday.

Before you join us, think about where you are and where you'd like to be.

I hope this group is a part of your new journey.

Navi
results.name: The NYC and NJ  Anger Management Meetup

results.description:
Are you Latino, single, and looking to make new friends? At our parties, get-togethers, and mixers, you will be able to meet other professional Latin men and women from the New York/New Jersey metro area.

Join us if you are an American Latino, Puerto Rican, Colombian, Ecuadorian, Dominican, Argentinian, Peruvian, Brazilian, Spanish, Uruguayan, Paraguayan, Panamanian, Chilean, Mexican, Honduran, Cuban, Guatemalan, Salvadorian, or from any other Latin country!

Our members are Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Vietnamese, Taiwanese, Thai, Filipino, and other Asian single professionals . We organize the most talked-about speed dating events in NYC for Asian single men and women.

results.description:
About WISE Meetup Group

Women Investors Strategic & Social Exchange (WISE) is a vast network of female business owners and professionals. We want success-minded women to have easy access to each other's skills, talents, knowledge and resources.

As small business owners and principals, we face unique challenges and we have a lot riding on our decisions and leadership. Now what? How can you increase your odds of success? Bring your successes, obstacles and questions to our interactive events.

  • Business Brunches
  • The WISE Breakfast Club
  • Networking/Social Events
  • Workshops/Seminars
  • Conferences

About Women Investors Strategic & Social Exchange (WISE)

Women Investors Strategic & Social Exchange (WISE)is dedicated to providing a platform for women across the country to successfully create business ownership and successfully invest as stakeholders both in the market and in real estate.
results.name: Women Investors Strategic & Social Exchange (WISE)

results.description:
Ciao a Tutti!

This group is for people who are learning Italian and want to practice speaking. It is also for people who are Italian and are learning English. The idea is for speakers to have no choice but to speak in the language they are learning in order to be understood. We are at all different levels, here. The important thing to is come to a meeting and don't worry about making mistakes! Speak!

Are you a beginner with Italian or would you like some resources for learning on your own? Visit our resources page.

Also, please read our group policies!

Questo gruppo è per le persone che stanno imparando l'inglese e vogliono esercitarsi a parlare. È anche per le persone che parla Inglese e stanno imparando l'Italiano. L'idea è di parlanti di non avere scelta se non quella di parlare nella lingua che stanno imparando in modo da essere capito.

Benvenutti al Gruppo e non ti preoccupare di fare errori! Parla!
results.name: Northern NJ Italian and English Language Exchange

results.description:
Online media and digital technologies are drastically changing the fashion industry and the way consumers interact with fashion brands. The first online community of fashion innovators, Fashion 2.0 has been on the frontier of innovation since 2008.

Fashion 2.0 meetups, presented by Style Coalition, bring together the people leading the fashion revolution online - entrepreneurs, bloggers, publishers, developers, industry insiders, PR & Marketing reps and other influencers.

The group accepts only professionals within the online fashion or tech industries as members.
results.name: Fashion 2.0

results.description:
Meet with local Revit users to discuss and share the platform's use for BIM implementation. Our group will cover Architecture, Structure and MEP.

Be sure to also check out a closely related Meetup - the Metro NYC BIM Group - at http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Metro-BIM.

Our group meetings are now held at the Pratt Manhattan Campus. Please visit Pratt's Center for Continuing and Professional Studies at http://prostudies.pratt.edu. They offer a wide range of continuing education courses including Revit, Inventor, 3DS Max and AutoCAD - many of which are eligible for CES Learning Units.

Pratt Institute now offers a 10% discount on CCPS non-credit courses to NYC RUG members. To get this discount you must do the following:

  • Make sure your FULL NAME is your user name on this Meetup.com site
  • Call (212) 647-7199 to register for classes, mention the Revit User Group discount BEFORE starting the registration process.
  • If you register for classes online at my.pratt.edu, you can have the discount applied afterward by calling (212) 647-7199.
results.name: New York City Revit User Group

results.description:
Thank You for joining the NYC Salsa and Dance Events Group a place for all Salsa PARTY lovers ;-)

If you like to go out and dance with Fun, Interesting, Beautiful people (both on the inside and outside) then THIS is the PLACE FOR YOU ;-)

If you you've never gotten into dancing Salsa but would love to learn then this is the group for you. We are a non judgmental crowd with members who range from beginner to intermediate to advanced.

Thanks for joining our group.

results.description:
If you want to meet some new people and learn how to dance salsa, bachata and any other dance, come join us at the Lorenz Latin Dance Studio, now with four locations in NYC! I personally encourage all of you to come out take some dance classes with us and attend our weekend latin dance socials, whether you're a beginner or professional.

Check out our Facebook Fan Page:  www.facebook.com/lorenzlatindancestudio to see all pictures and videos of all our classes in all four locations, or visit our website at www.lorenzdancestudio.com for the class schedules in each of our four locations:  Corona, Glendale, Bronx or Manhattan!
results.name: New York City Salsa & Bachata Dancing

results.description: Meet other young professionals-men and women- ages of 21+ that are interested in staying active, playing sports, and being social! This meetup group will focus on different organized sports in parks somewhere in Bridgewater and New Brunswick NJ.  We offer several different sports leagues.
results.name: Co-ed Sports Central NJ Young Professionals 21+

results.description:
New technology is disrupting Finance in every area - Banking, Payments, Multi asset trading, Brokerage, Investment, Money management, Funding, E-Commerce. It is also making Finance easily accessible to everyone.

The FinTech meetup puts on financial technology meetup events that take place in New York City and are designed to connect New York City based decision makers in the financial sector with new and innovative financial technologies.

The meetups feature industry leaders, thought leaders, and financial technology entrepreneurs as speakers and discussion leaders addressing key financial technology needs, applications, innovations, issues and offering excellent networking opportunities.

We are all about making connections to connect financial industry decision makers with new and innovative financial technologies and to discuss key industry issues.
results.name: FinTech Meetup

results.description: Thanks for taking the poll. And thank you those of you who have emailed me and offered to help! You are all awesome. Details to come -- I may be setting up the games via and other group. More info to come for December -- you'll get an email with details. NOTE: CHECK BACK FOR UPDATES. WE ARE ON HIATUS! THANKS :). I HIGHLY RECOMMEND "MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER" run by Simon. I've played several times with his group and it's EXCELLENT. Join that here: http://www.meetup.com/MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER/ The only Manhattan Pick-up soccer group for beginners ONLY! No slide-tackling, no pushing people over, no fighting, no acting like soccer is war. This is fun, friendly and ONLY for people looking to boost their soccer skills while meeting fun new people. NOT for people who: played your whole life, considered going pro, get frustrated with a slow game, have EVER gotten in a meet-up soccer fight. FOR people who: played long, long ago, are just learning, want to improve skills, are a good player but want to help others learn (and don't mind a very slow game). Why Join? We're the only Manhattan beginning meet-up. Get outside, get great exercise, get in shape for the summer, and meet some new people ? all in a low-pressure, fun environment. This is about the fun of the game, not showing off or winning. We have games all over and are in the process of getting permits for September. This is a very informal group. Join us for practice sessions, plenty of kicking the ball around, and some games. Often, we'll meet in Central Park.
results.name: The Manhattan (Beginning) Pick-up Soccer Meetup

results.description:
"Waking up" is associated with getting enlightened or free by rising out of imprisonment in your karma, body-mind, and relationships.

"Waking down" differs from waking up out of life.

Saniel Bonder is the founder of the Waking Down in Mutuality work. He and his wife, Linda, are founding members of Ken Wilber's Integral Institute and charter members of the Integral Spiritual Center.

This Meetup is for other locals to discuss and practice mutuality. Our work is to practice radical acceptance in the moment, bringing compassion and kindness to each other where there used to be pressure to change or be different. In this climate of safety, deep healing and transformation will occur organically through the wisdom of Being and according to each person?s own right timing.

All are welcome. You may have an extensive spiritual history, or little, or none. You may feel hunger, dissatisfaction, pain, or futility.

Come to a Waking Down in Mutuality Meetup and give yourself the chance to steep in a sacred space dedicated entirely to the deepening recognition of all that we are.
results.name: New York City Waking Down in Mutuality

results.description:
Hook up with other arthouse film kindred spirits

  • Discover cool local indie films hot off the presses.
  • Promote YOUR film to NJ/NY movie-lovers
  • Explore the idea of making your own videos.
  • Take or offer film-study or film-craft workshops & seminars
  • Find film acting, writing or directing coach services

Join the NY Indie Film Group at http://meetup.com/nyindiefilm
results.name: NJ Indie Film Lovers

results.description:
Looking to get into the best shape of your life? Come and learn how to use kettlebells, the perfect tool to get in shape, fast!

Come join us for a session - your first workout is FREE!

Build muscle
Lose fat
Improve endurance
Increase flexibility

Howie Brewer, of Kettlebells NY, is a certified fitness trainer through the American Kettlebell Club and the International Kettlebell & Fitness Federation, and will be taking you through an hour of kettlebell work.

No more boring treadmills! Have fun swinging kettlebells. Correctly learn a variety of exercises that you can take anywhere. All are welcome.

Meetings will be held at the Herb Reisman Sports Complex off of Route 45 in Spring Valley (just North of New Hempstead Rd), next to the Pavilion as you enter.
results.name: American Eagle MMA & Kettlebell Club

results.description:
Who are The New York City Sea Gypsies?

Founded by local scuba divers and instructors in 1971, we are a not-for-profit club made up of individuals of diverse ages and from all walks of life with one thing in common, we all share a love of scuba diving.

For some, this means local wreck diving every weekend. For others it's about exotic diving vacations to all parts of the world. Some enjoy underwater photography or videography, others seek artifacts or hunt lobsters, while many others just enjoy the underwater sights. A number of our members have been diving for over 30 years; some are just beginning their journey into the fascinating underwater world.

We actively encourage safe diving and encourage continuing education to improve diving skill.

Whatever your own interests, there's someone in the club you can talk to about local diving, worldwide destinations, wrecks, cave diving, gear, ecology, marine life, photography, dive safety and medicine, or any other dive-related subject.
results.name: NYC Sea Gypsies - New York City's Dive Club

results.description: Reiki Master, author Cheryl Glover facilitates healing group in Middletown. Come and learn about Holistic and hands on healing, Reiki, Kabbalah and more. Group is an actual healing circle where you can come and meet people interested in spiritual healing and experience healing yourself!!
results.name: Spiritual Healing Circle

results.description:
Young professional women -- join us and build your most compatible group of friends! Meet fun, smart chic chicks like yourself! 

TO JOIN: Take the FREE quiz here: www.chicchickfriends.com. Email your results to: yourdreamslifecoach@gmail.com!!

THIS IS FOR: Women in NYC who want to expand your social circle with compatible female girl friends who are a good personality type match for you!

WE DO: Fun things museums, brunch, Central Park, sports, dancing, nightlife, dining, cultural events, wine tastings! We have a friendly, laid back vibe and plenty of introductions/small group activities. 

HOW IT WORKS: You get a free personality quiz. At the event you'll get a name tag with your personality type symbol on it, making it easy to spot your most compatible friend matches!

When you first arrive, we do introductions. Then we break into small groups of your most compatible peeps. After breaking the ice, we do the activity we had planned. 

Come hang with us, have fun, meet friends you're actually compatible with!

NOTE: Single? Join our new group and meet compatible guys! http://singles.meetup.com/2402/
results.name: The Manhattan Chic Chick Friends (20s-30s)

results.description:
Visit www.shorewalkers.org to view the complete calendar of upcoming walks, view, download and print our newsletter, join; and learn about the history of Shorewalkers. Follow Shorewalkers on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Shorewalkers.
Shorewalkers promotes walking and hiking for fitness, recreation & fun. We support and advocate environmental and civic causes including development of our greenways, maintenance and improvement of trails, and the health benefits of walking. Questions about hikes should be directed to the Leader in the hike description not to the Meetup Organizers.  You will receive emails when a walk is announced and one week and one day before the walk, manage these settings under the Account link.

Voluntary membership fees: $20/individual and $25/family. Activities are free to members. Nonmembers are welcome to participate for a voluntary donation per event.

Shorewalkers does not tolerate inappropriate behavior during its events. If you are subject to or witness any inappropriate behavior during a Shorewalker event, please contact  the Shorewalker Meetup Organizers directly and report the behavior. Shorewalkers will investigate any reports of inappropriate behavior and take necessary action. 


Your participation in any of our activities is your acknowledgment that you are solely responsible for your own assessment of your abilities and your physical fitness to participate in that activity. Walkers must be physically fit and by joining any event you agree to waive all rights and claims for damages against Shorewalkers, it’s officers, or it’s Leaders.

We encourage and appreciate posting pictures taken during Shorewalkers events. Shorewalkers reserves the right to use the photos in any manner and for any reason, except for commercial purposes, without renumeration or credit.
results.name: Shorewalkers

results.description: Prepare to discover new things about yourself, push the limits and get deep into the real you. Through tantra practice we become free, we become great lovers, experience full body transcendental orgasms and reach the state of bliss and cosmic intimacy like we could never imagine before. Come, join us. This gift is already yours. All you have to do is finally claim it.
results.name: The New York Tantric Meetup

results.description:
This group meets in Manhattan on weekends to play board games and card games. The emphasis is on party games more than Euro and strategy games and we are happy to teach games to newcomers. Games played include Apples to Apples, Scattergories, Uno, and many others. A list of games played is in the Discussions section.  Different games are played at each meetup. Both singles and couples are welcome. Adults of all ages are welcome.

Meetups are free and we often meet in pubs and restaurants.
results.name: NYC Friendly People Games

results.description:
Think- trips to the sex museum, workshops, opportunities to purchase things, ask questions, discuss roe v. wade, learn to pole dance. If it has to do with redeeming your sexuality- this is the place!

This is an upscale group- and we sell toys, take field trips, learn and do educational workshops for adults of all ages.

The audience is mature and we feel like we can have open conversations and explore sexuality and learn together without being embarrassed. We talk about the politics of sex, invite speakers and authors, throw bashes and make friends.

As a high class group, we are open to students, professionals in the adult industry, mothers, people looking to spice up their sex life, or who have somthing to offer.

Its a classy and upscale safe space for people to learn and have a good time socializing and being comfortable.

Join us if you like sex and the city, if you're confident, if you're not, if you're curious, questioning, dating, married, virginal, experienced, if you have something to offer or have questions to ask. We're open to everyone and are respectful.

IMPORTANT:  Each member must be at least 21 years of age, and is required to post a photo of their face (without sunglasses), and answer the profile questions.  This is a private meetup group, so member names and photos are only viewable by other members of the group.  I have the photo requirement for several reasons, one of which is to be able to determine gender where the name does not readily disclose that information.  New members who do not include a photo with their sign-up and make a reasonable effort to answer the profile questions will not be accepted.  Thank you for your cooperation.
results.name: Sex(uality) in the City

results.description:
Join Brooklynites interested in getting to know their neighbors at relaxed social events. We're based in the Lefferts Gardens and Flatbush areas where people from diverse cultures, social backgrounds, and interests live. But anyone curious about our neighborhoods is welcome. Come to make friends, socialize, and share resources in our community!

TO JOIN: Because we want to create a sense of community, please introduce yourself by filling out the online profile questions AND add a photo of you where you are clearly recognizable. Read the ABOUT page for details.

FACEBOOK: Join the new online version of our group on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=156999290136

"Maybe we should all cross the invisible lines between our homes and achieve greater unity in the places we live....Why not try it today?"(P. Lovenheim) Spend a social evening with neighbors!
results.name: Prospect-Lefferts Gardens, Flatbush, & Brooklyn Neighbors

results.description:
Gentlemen!!! Welcome to the new and improved (and recently renamed!) EatOut NewYork.

and...

Let's eat!


We're an outgoing and friendly group of gay men from all walks of life — over 750 strong —who enjoy meeting up with other guys while sharing a meal.


Whether you're the gentleman who enjoys a perfectly prepared steak-frites and a good Haut-Medoc, the Brooklyn hipster wanting to eat his way through the city's hottest new eateries, the foodie geek on the prowl for ramps and unusual animal parts, the Martha-Stewart/Julia Child inspired home chef/entertainer, or even just the Dude who loves to meet up with friends over pints and buffalo wings at the corner bar, YOU ARE WELCOME HERE.

Looking forward to meeting....
results.name: EatOut New York

results.description:
WELCOME TO THE DOLLHOUSE NY/NJ EDITION!

The Dollhouse is a unique Meetup group designed just for women with alternative lifestyles and their friends! More than just a conventional dating service or party promotion site, we host events throughout the city to provide our members with safe, positive and fun environments in which we support and encourage each other. The Dollhouse provides Lesbians,Bisexual women, Trans women, Queer women & their friends an opportunity to meet, network, & socialize with women who share similar interests in the New York City/New Jersey area.

We are professional and positive women who are ready to meet other like-minded women who want to promote peace within our community. Labels do not matter with us. There are events for you whatever your preference is. All we ask is that you be open minded with a positive attitude. We strive to empower each other.

We host a variety of events which include anything from bowling, parties & lounges, billiards, brunches, movies, dinners, concerts, bull riding, and even traveling out of town! Dollhouse is open to suggestions at all times.

The purpose of Dollhouse is to provide events that will allow you to meet with women in person and step away from the gadgets! Our culture is quickly robbing us of our social skills and it is time to get up and get out!!!

Join the Dollhouse and come play with us!

Wen P.

aka Skinny

Director of NY/NJ Dollhouse
results.name: NY/NJ Dollhouse

results.description:
This group is dedicated to advancing innovations that focus on improving patient care with the active involvement of Patients, Physicians, Nurses, Administrators, Engineers, and even Lawyers.  If your interest is in improving the practice and performance of medicine, than this is the meetup for you.

Eugene Borukovich started the New York Health Innovation Group in 2008.  Not long after he affiliated with the Health 2.0 organization and became the first local chapter of the new conference company. Our chapter has since grown to become the largest healthcare innovation focused meetup in the world, running events that focus on specific topics such as the impact of social media in Healthcare or our Startup pitch contest called "Pitch Yourself into the Shark Tank."  Hundreds of investments, partnerships and collaborations have come from our events, hackathons, contests, and our crowdfunding platform, MedStartr.com.  A few of the companies that have presented: Phreesia, Zweena, ZocDoc, HelloHealth, Medivo, Avado, YourNurseIsOn, DrChrono, ComScore, Intelliquit, Psious, EpionHealth, Healthrageous, WellApps, MisFit, DocGraph, Regiaster Patient, and over three hundred more.  We have hosted HealthCamp and Todd Park, Bryan Sivak, Regina Holliday, Esther Dyson, Todd Pietri, and representatives from every major Healthcare Venture Capital and Angel group in the Northeast.  The net result is a community of health innovators, accelerators, venture capitalists, hospitals, doctors, patients programmers, and more with a can do attitude that is changing healthcare every day.

We organize this group as our way of saying thanks for helping us launch FairCareMD in 2010 and MedStartr in 2012...but this isn't about us, it is what our thousands of members, creators and adopters of healthcare innovation can do for healthcare.

Who presents here?

    Patients who have defined issues to be addressed and / or designed apps to improve their health and the health of others

    Physicians who create innovative care models, develop solutios, or simply are looking for new ways to address the problems they see

    Entrepreneurs who create new innovative healthcare solutions

    Hospital Executives driving development and adoption of new ideas

    Nurses who reinvent nursing management or point of care solutions

    Investors, Angels, and VCs looking for the next big thing

    Pharma, Insurance, and Diagnostics companies that look for new technologies and companies to work with

    Pharmacists who design better medication management, adherence, distribution or other systems

    Game Designers who make patient education fun

    Quantification companies that help people self-monitor (see also Quantified Self meetup)

    Engineers, Programmers, and Hackers that invent and enable new care paradigms

    Designers who love to design Killer Apps for Healthy Living

    Innovative Government leaders seeking positive change

    Reporters and Bloggers who want to see the cutting edge before it happens and spread the word

    and so many more amazing people and companies...

Mostly what we have are the leaders of the NYC healthcare innovation scene.  By putting us all together in one place, we are creating the future of healthcare and making New York the healthcare innovation capital of the world.

We are always looking for start-ups and individuals to present the ideas or products they are passionate about. Please be welcome to join the conversation, propose a topic, or suggest an alternative format. We are a largely user-driven group, so suggest a topic and we will do the most popular event.

We also enable more established companies to get their message out to the healthcare innovation community through sponsorship and speaking.  So if there is an event, challenge, or product release you would like to talk about, please contact me.

Thanks for visiting, we hope to see you soon!

-Alex Fair (@alexbfair) and Anthony Manson (@DigitalRants)

Organizers Health 2.0 NYC (@H2NYC)

Cofounder: MedStartr (@MedStartr) - the Leading Healthcare Crowdfunding Platform
results.name: Health 2.0 NYC - The New York Healthcare Innovation Group

results.description:
Are you interested in meeting people, getting a taste of other faith traditions, and sharing elements of your own religion with others?

Faith House Manhattan is an experiential inter-religious community that organizes regular events to learn about other faiths, explore and share our own, and forge meaningful connections with people of other faiths or no faith at all.

Every other week Faith House hosts a Living Room Gathering where we share holy days, learn new spiritual practices, and address current cultural and social issues. Each gathering has a specific theme and hands-on, participatory elements.

Faith House Manhattan also arranges field trips to visit various sacred spaces in New York City with the support of a group. We provide opportunities to volunteer together to end poverty, increase environmental justice, spread awareness, and promote peace in New York City and in the world.

Other wonderful, interfaith events in NYC are also featured on our Meetup calendar. Please send event ideas for the Meetup Calendar to info@faithhousemanhattan.org with the subject line "MeetUp Idea."

We plan to resume our programming in September, so stay tuned!

Visit us on our website: www.faithhousemanhattan.org, twitter: @faithhousenow, and facebook: bit.ly/fhgroup!

Learn from the Bhagavad Gita about dealing with our world's challenges and our day to day life issues. We meet at a Park in summers and our East Village studio in Winters. This is a young fun group! Feel free to bring your version of the Bhagavad Gita. We discuss the Gita all levels-spiritual, philosophical, and intellectual putting it in context to today's world.

"When disappointment stares in the face and all alone I see not one ray of light, I go back to the Bhagavad Gita. I find a verse here and a verse there, and I immediately begin to smile in the midst of overwhelming tragedies – and my life has been full of external tragedies – and if they have left no visible, no indelible scar on me, I owe it all to the teaching of the Bhagavad Gita."-MAHATAMA GANDHI

The NYC VOLLEYBALL OPEN COURT [VOC] is at Riverbank State Park, NYC (145th Street & Riverside Drive, NYC).

WELCOME to NYC VOLLEYBALL OPEN COURT [VOC], New York City 's premiere volleyball facility.  Finding a time and place in NYC to play and learn to play volleyball can be tough, but with VOC, we have volleyball on Mondays and Wednesdays – always at the same time and place.

"SAME PLACE-SAME COURT-SAME TIME"! Always from 7PM-10PM

The VOC court containing a  gym-floor with more space around the court and more headroom than any other volleyball gym in Manhattan. The Head Coach will run you through a high-paced workout in the volleyball fundamentals [Setting, Passing, Hitting, Blocking, Serving and more; average ball touches per/player/practice=330] and will also run through team drills such as aspects of the 6-2 or 5-1 systems. Live Reggae NYC the #1 and

fastest growing Reggae Meetup in the NYC area!

There are excellent Reggae events happening all around NYC tri-state area and we know how to find them! The Live Reggae NYC (LRNYC) Meetup is for Reggae lovers and those who are curious about the music and ready to experience more. All members are eligible for FREE and discount admission to select events hosted by top producers, promoters and venues!

MORE ABOUT US!

LRNYC is dedicated to upholding the rich musical legacies of Bob Marley, Dennis Brown and other Reggae greats and the One Love vibe! Everyone is welcomed to join and our members hail from all walks of life but live or work in and around the NYC tri-state region. We post a wide variety of amazing LIVE Reggae concerts, shows, specialty parties, "invitation only" and underground events for you to select. Once you’ve joined you’re asked to participate in a minimum of three events per year; start making plans to linkup with new people make new friends with similar interest and to stay or get in touch with your inner Reggae vibe! You select, we’ll do all the rest and all members are treated like VIP's!

MEMBERSHIP REQUIREMENTS!

1. You should live or work in the NY tri-state area or close enough to participate in the Meetup!

2. Upload a photo of yourself keeping in mind that fliers, posters, album covers or any type of advertising is not permitted and reserved for our great sponsors.

3. To remain a member in good standing simply respond to invitations and attend a minimum of three events per year. No-shows at events are a no-no and you may be removed without advance warning.

JOIN OUR VIP LIST FOR EVEN MORE GREAT PERKS!

LiveReggaeNYC@gmail.com

INTERESTED IN SPONSORING OR ADVERTISING?

results.description:
The Brooklyn Futurist Meetup is where we  discuss what the world might look like in ten years or more. Speakers explore trends with transformative potential... or ones that are just fascinating.

Our events usually run in Brooklyn where most members work or live. Topics are not Brooklyn-focused. They are open to attendees and speakers from anywhere. This is America's largest future-focused meetup with 3,700+ members and the second largest globally. We also run a global network of future-focused meetups with tens of thousands more like-minded members in cities like Stockholm, Bangalore, London, Berlin and Singapore. Contact the organizer for details. 

We meet 4-6 times per year with presentations by guest speakers, followed by spirited, respectful discussion. We encourage you to mingle with fellow attendees before and afterwards. Review our member profiles - you'll find an amazing array of entrepreneurs, contrarians, tech visionaries, big thinkers, creative types and more.

Our topics are unlimited. Past events looked at music, chocolate, now futurism, women in innovation, sustainability, space commercialization, the Lowline, the Ocean, web privacy, 3D Printing and media. We're planning more exciting programs in culture, science, technology, education, entertainment, commerce and societal relations. Your suggestions for topics, speakers, event formats, partners, perks and sponsors are welcome.


Twitter: @BkFuturist


Media Coverage:

August 2015 Focal Press User Group of the Month. 


The Guardian by Jordan Hoffman (April 2015):  http://www.theguardian.com/culture/2015/apr/29/meet-the-brooklyn-futurist-the-group-using-star-trek-to-save-the-world

http://www.outerplaces.com/science/item/8756/star-trek-writer-claims-that-one-episode-predicted-real-life-memory-modification-technologies

Observer - Reuters's Tom Glocer: Why Does The New York Times Need to have 6,700 Journalists?


Livestream of our April 23, 2015 Meetup with Morgan Gendel:  http://livestream.com/LivestreamPublic/BrooklynFuturist

Password: meetup12

Part 2: https://vimeo.com/54607822 Password:meetup12


Read More Articles About the Future: 

http://www.meetup.com/BLKNY30/pages/Futuris...;


Stay tuned for more futurist resources - books, videos, events - check out the "pages" tab.

Want to be an assistant organizer of this fast growing influential group? Contact us to help with speaker recruiting, marketing/sponsorships/partnerships, audience experience roles and more.


Interested in sponsoring our meetup or meetup networks?

We welcome inquiries from sponsors for ongoing or one-time support of our meetups. Please contact Mike Taubleb the organizer. We are always looking to improve the turnout, content and networking aspects of our meetups, as well as ways to fund the highest visibility guest speakers possible.


Do you Organize another Future-Focused Meetup - anywhere in the world? Join our new network: 

http://www.meetup.com/Global-Network-of-Future-Focused-Meetup-Organizers/


Do you Organize a Large NY Metro-Area Meetup on Business, Tech, Science or of a Social Nature?  Join our new organizers' network:

http://www.meetup.com/Major-Meetup-Network/


Have an event to share with our 3,400+ members, NY Network of Major Meetups or Global Network of Futurist Groups:

Please don't post it without getting our written permission first or we'll remove it. If it is something worth emailing our members, please contact organizer well in advance (at least 2 weeks out), so we can coordinate with our other member emails. If you are promoting a clearly commercial enterprise, we'll generally request a discount code for our members and a free admission for one or two - or sponsorship of our meetup. We often co-promote, co-produce events with other meetups and show them the courtesy of getting explicit permission beforehand. Appreciate you doing the same for us.

Liability Waiver:

This is NOT a Professionally Organized Event and we are not professional organizers. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well-being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Meetup Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Hosts or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

WELCOME BLACK THEATER LOVERS

ENJOY BROADWAY, OFF-BROADWAY & REGIONAL THEATER PRODUCTIONS!

Love great theater and film and the possibility of meeting new friends -- then Role Call is the place for you! With this group, there's no need to go to the theater alone. You'll join other theater and movie lovers at a variety of stage and screen productions, particularly those that exemplify Black life and culture and are geared towards Black theater-goers. Whether it's a Broadway or off-Broadway show, a drama, musical, comedy, solo-performance or even an indie or feature film, we've got your tickets so there's no need to stand in the TKTS line! Join Role Call -- The Ticket to Black Theater!

NOTE:  An actual facial photo of yourself (no images, flowers, caricatures) is needed to join the group.

 

A Few Broadway Shows We've Enjoyed!

    • Holler If Ya Hear Me inspired by the music of Tupac Shakur!

    • A Raisin In The Sun starring Denzel Washington!

    • The Trip to Bountiful starring Cicely Tyson, Vanessa Williams, Cuba Gooding, Jr., and Condola Rashad!

    • The Mountaintop starring Samuel L. Jackson & Angela Bassett!

    • Baby It's You based on the recording group, The Shirelle's!

    • The Scottsboro Boys starring Colman Domingo!

    • Race starring Kerry Washington & David Alan Grier!

    • Fela starring Lillias White!

A Few Off-Broadway Shows We've Enjoyed!

A Few Comments From Our Members!

• Darice on In the Heights!

"Of all of the plays we've seen, this was my absolute favorite!! The music was fantastic, the messages were uplifting and overall theme of community, family and unity was universally applicable to all of us. I left the theater uplifted and inspired."


• Sharon on Broke-ology!

"I thoroughly enjoyed this play. It brought to light the subject of aging and illness and how it affects the family structure. I thought it was nice to delve into the life of african american men who are struggling to have their own lives while dealing with the illness of their father. It was funny, poignant, thought provoking."

Role Call Members with actresses at St. Luke's Theatre

Event:  Sistas The Musical w/Pre & Post Show Exclusives

Role Call Members at Atlanta Marriott Buckhead Hotel

Event:  City by Day, Theater by Night Weekend in Atlanta!

Role Call Members at National Black Theater

Event:  Hattie What I Need You To Know

*****

Join The Role Call Theater Group!

*Post-Theater Meal Discussions*

I love post-show discussions with this group of theatre lovers! Conversation is lively and insightful. I always learn a lot. It's a wonderful way to enjoy and share the theatre experience. -- Naima

I have found that even a play that seems disappointing is ripe for a good exchange of opinions and commentary. This group is great at picking apart all the details and subtleties. -- Sandra

*Road Trips to Regional Theaters*

Once again, the road trip was wonderful.  We had a great time. The play was excellent. I saw Ben Vereen in a new light. The play left us with a lot to discuss for it speaks of the psychic dualism of the African-American. I came from the play and dinner discussion enlightened and ready to do some research. -- Charisse

I felt like I was going on a field trip, something I haven’t done in so long. The road trip was awesome.  The play was excellent. The other thing that was great was the connection and the discussion that we had. -- Carolyn



* Weekend Theater Retreats*

The Atlanta trip was wonderful. No detail was overlooked, from the beautifully coordinated welcome packet with copies of the script, to the locations for the cultural tour, the dinner and finally the play which was insightful, funny, and totally enjoyable. Can't wait to do this again! -- Phyllis

A wonderful restorative experience.  I left feeling totally rejuvenated! The play allowed us to laugh at issues we are all familiar with while the city tour provided time for reflection on our culture. I was moved and healed. Well done. -- Rene

*Book Discussions for Plays*

I liked the play a lot and I thoroughly enjoyed the discussion over brunch. I came away with a deeper understanding of the themes, the characters and issues in the play that are relevant today. I feel encouraged to read more plays - and that's a good thing. -- Naima

I loved it. This was a great discussion! We thoroughly discussed this play from top to bottom. Everyone had so many different opinions and I enjoyed hearing them all. This play touched on social issues that are still quite relevant in today's society. Would love to have seen this production on stage, but I'm very happy to have read and discussed it with such informed readers. Looking forward to doing it again! -- Pat

*Theater Lover Brunches*

I love brunch! It is the best social meal you can have. I so enjoyed having brunch with the ladies from this group. Especially the get-to-know-you ice breaker that we played. Good food, good laughs and great company to enjoy it all. -- Aicha

Great group of folks; had a great time!  Gave a great table talk activity to soften the mood. I look forward to attending many meetups with them in the future. -- Sandy

 

*Informative Role Call Brochures*

The organizer distributed a handout about the play & detailing upcoming events and made sure to introduce everyone. Very professionally run!  -- Robyn

The wonderful brochure provided even more insight to the play.  It really enhanced the overall experience.  I look forward to attending many more events with this group. -- Marnita
results.name: Role Call -- The Ticket to Black Theater!

results.description:
BLUE LOTUS HEART CHI GONG SELF~ That's the state you find inside when you  understand your own energy and how it works in the world. You feel calmer, more confident, and less likely to be swayed by the emotions, stress, and energies around you in our busy world.  BLUE LOTUS HEART CHI GONG SELF is YOU, decompressed, comfortable, more easy in your life.

No matter how much you learn, or how much coffee you drink, there is only so much stimulation that any one human body can handle before it overloads.  You might need to decompress at times, take a moment to yourself.  In even one minute, you can offload the cares and stress of the world and re-enter Blue Lotus Heart Chi Gong Self.  It is so easy, and really very wonderful.  Join us, and learn more.  Ferol Humphrey, Founder.

For more information, visit ferolhumphrey.com or text or call 972-489-9123.

results.description: Meet other local caving (i.e. spelunking) enthusiasts to discuss your love of the underground. Learn how to participate in caving adventures, whether locally on day trips, or in Pennsylvania and upstate New York on weekend trips, week long trips throughout the US, and longer expeditions throughout the world. Loaner equipment (helmets & head lamps) and training provided. We are a mixed group, ranging from those who explore simple cave systems without the aid of any special technical equipment and training, to those who use ropes to rappel into deep pits on the order of hundreds of feet in depth, and scuba to explore complicated underwater passages on the order of miles in length. We also have members who specialise in such things as cave biology, photography, archeology and cartograpphy. While some of our members are new to caving, others have been involved in it for well over 20 to 30 years. And while some spend most of their time doing day trips to local caves, others devote their time to traveling to remote areas around the world for weeks at a time, under the most extreme of conditions. Note: Meetings monthly the 4th Wednesday. Affiliated with UAYCEF (www.uaycef.com)

results.description: This is the perfect meeting place for we all indians,be it for social networking or for somebody who wants to enjoy a weekend beyond just plain dining out as most of our meetups are laced with live music or karaoke singing and members just enjoy the vibrant and charged up atphosphere during the meetups.Most of the times the meetups are organized at the places where our members can chill out by having a drink or two or just take to dance floor to enjoy a completely satisfying evening.For the members who love outdoors we also conduct a day out picnics/outings once in a month and plans are also on to have small 3-4 days excursions/retreats once in 3-6 months during off season period when the discounts and attractive offers are plenty from travel agents /goverment institutions/or other cultural & spiritual organisations. NORMAL ACTIVITIES OF THE GROUP 1-ATTEND MUSICAL CONCERTS/KNOCK OUT BOLLYWOOD MOVIE SCREENINGS WHICH IS GENERALLY FOLLOWED BY A DINNER AT A NEAR BY PLACE. 2-CONDUCT KARAOKE OR LIVE MUSIC SHOWS WHERE MEMBERS CAN SING THEMSELVES IF THEY SO DESIRE OR JUST TAKE TO THE DANCE FLOOR ,THIS IS GENERALLY FOLLOWED WITH A DINNER AT THE SAME PLACE.ON AN AVERAGE WE CONDUCT ONE OR TWO SUCH EVENTS IN A MONTH. 3-DINING OUT/SOCIALIZING/MAKING NEW CONTACTS /FRIENDS OVER A LUNCH OR DINNER AT A REAL HAPPENING PLACE OR SOME PICNIC SPOT IN THE CITY WHERE WE MAKE ARRANGEMENTS WITH OUR OWN FOOD OR SOMETIMES MEMBERS JOINTLY ARRANGE FOR A POTLUCK AND ENJOY THE HOME MADE FOOD IN NATURAL SURROUNDINGS. 4-ARRANGING SMALL DAYOUT OUTINGS /PICNICS/ADVENTURE TREKS TO NEARBY PICNIC SPOTS/HOLIDAY RESORTS/OR OTHER HAPPENING PLACES IN NEARBY STATES/CITIES (within100-200 miles) ONCE IN A MONTH.THIS IS GENERALLY DONE ON WEEKENDS AND NOW THE PLANS ARE ON TO CONDUCT 3-4 DAYS EXCURSIONS/RETREATS ,THIS WILL BE DONE ONCE IN 3-6 MONTHS WHEN IT IS A OFF SEASON PERIOD AND DISCOUNTS AND ATTRACTIVE OFFERS ARE APLENTY FROM THE TRAVEL AGENTS /GOVERMENT ORGANISATIONS/OTHER CULTURAL /SPIRITUAL ORGANISATIONS. Besides the above recreational activities we also encourage the meetings of both young and senior members especially during the outdoor meetings and family get togethers to understand the cultural legacy we have inherited and connect with our heritage and our indian roots..This is specially neccessary for the young indians who have grown and been brought up in american culture since thier chilhood and who are completely cut off from our indian roots and culture.

results.description:
HOW PICK UP WORKS: Cleats are optional, and sometimes depend on the field. Most are more comfortable WITH cleats. SHIN GUARDS ARE STRONGLY RECOMMENDED. . Generally, recreational pick-up soccer is a fun activity, not competitive. With this group, attracting any random person over the internet, I expect it to be extremely friendly and have an emphasis on fun and exercise rather than competition. We'll play for 2-3 hours. We'll voluntarily split into two teams, set up goals, and play.

Code of Conduct:

* Language: The use of profane or improper language, is not acceptable. Extreme verbal outbursts show a lack of self-control and immaturity.

* Attitude: There is an expectation that all athletes be courteous, mature, cooperative and respectful at all times. Individuals should conduct themselves with the knowledge that they, alone, are responsible for their own actions.

* Sportsmanship and Fair Play: sportsmanship and fair play to teammates and opponents. No name calling, bullying, discrimination or aggressiveness is allowed at any meetup.

Failure to help make this meetup an enjoyable experience for the rest of the members may result in the removal of you membership. For players seeking more competitive environments we recommend joining local soccer leagues or other venues.

Enjoy!
results.name: Stamford CT Pick-up Soccer Meetup Group

results.description:
It can be hard to find partners if your free time is during the day. Lets use this group not only for the regular meetings on Fridays, but as a gathering place for partner-finding. Take each others numbers, post on the discussion board, reach out and find each other! The great thing about climbing is that students, home-workers, and professionals ditching their lunchtime meeting can all climb together. I'm open to members self-organizing their own days. Beginners are always welcome!

Details:
Fridays 11am-1pm
Cost: There's no fee but you will need to pay for a day pass if you're not a member and rent equipment if you don't have your own.
Day pass: $15
Rental equipment: $4.50 for shoes, $4.50 for harness

How it works: We'll introduce new people to the regular crew and get you climbing. If you know how to belay you can jump in and climb with anyone. If you don't know how to belay there will always be folks who are happy to belay you for a few climbs. If you love it (as we're sure you will!) you can sign up for a belay class.

If you have any questions about the night or about climbing please send me an email and I'll be happy to help any way I can.

I hope to see you at the gym soon!

The Rock Club
914-633-ROCK
www.ClimbRockClub.com

results.description:
Do you live in northern New Jersey and want to play lots of tennis? Join us.

This is a social group designed to bring together recreational tennis players of all levels who want to find partners to play and socialize with. We host events regularly at several Hudson County public tennis courts and occasionally feature social events. Please, take advantage of the message board or email group members directly to find tennis partners.

Beginners are welcome, however we do not provide tennis instruction. For those who have little/no experience, we recommend you take a few introductory lessons so that you have some of the basic skills needed to enjoy the sport.

During the warm weather we typically schedule events throughout the week. In the winter we use some of the local indoor courts so players can keep their skills fresh year round.

Please consider donating to keep this group going. Meetup charges organizers a yearly fee of nearly $150.00. A $5.00 donation from members would help cover this cost and be much appreciated. Many thanks!

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=4JM263A7D66UY

CONGRATULATIONS TO 2010 GRAMMY WINNER ZAC BROWN, WHO WON THE 2010 GRAMMY FOR BEST NEW ARTIST! THE NEW YORK CITY LIVE MUSIC MEETUP ATTENDED A PERFORMANCE BY ZAC AND HIS BAND, AND THEN PERSONALLY MET ZAC AND HIS BAND, AT A MEETUP ORGANIZED BY RICH CASELLA ON AUGUST 26, 2008. CHECK OUT THE PHOTOS.

Meet local Spanish language and culture lovers for conversation, cultural exchange, and fun in New York City! Come to a Spanish Fanaticos Meetup event and make new amigos while speaking in Spanish, learning new vocabulary, putting your grammar knowledge into practice and/or simply brushing up your Spanish skills!

Some of our events include: Spanish Grammar and Literature Workshops, Social Networking Events, Happy Hours, Dinners, Coffee Time, Hikes, Picnics, Movie Nights, Dancing and more. All ages and levels welcome. Join this group for FREE and never miss an event again!

This Conversational Spanish practice group is sponsored by http://www.spanishblackbelt.com, a leading Spanish language tutoring center servicing Manhattan. This groups aims at providing Spanish students and native Spanish speakers with the opportunity to locally connect, practice and learn from each other in a very informal manner. Spanish Black Belt sponsors events within this group to facilitate interaction and relationships across the Latino culture and other cultures.

So come join us! We'd love to have you as a part of our group. Please provide a photo of yourself when you join so that we know who you are when you come out to join us for an event!!! Thanks!

results.description:
Welcome back to all of you! Formerly the Raw Foods Group of Greenwich, founded by Shona (thank you, Shona xo), we are now officially known as Ecstatic Eating!tm Raw Foods Meetup of Connecticut, or just Ecstatic Eating! for short. Though our gatherings will take place in Stamford, CT, we welcome raw food enthusiasts from all over; NY, NJ, VT, MA and anyone traveling the world and stopping in CT along the way.

My goal is to bring people together into community through raw foods education and great conversation! As a Holistic Health Counselor and therapist, I have lived the raw foods lifestyle for the past six years, and as many of you know, it is a life-changing way of eating. I look forward to sharing my knowledge with you and learning from your store of wisdom as well.

Raw food taps into what I call, "the Quantum Physics of Nutrition." Not only does it alkalize out bodies, but it also elevates our psyches, mood and energy. When something so "alive" goes into you, it can only make you more alive; every cell of your body starts to wake up.

I plan to host Raw Food Meetup Potlucks once a month; I'll be sending out the first date really soon, so stay tuned. We have a great location in Stamford in which to meet and "break flax."

I will also be teaching raw classes once again, for those of you who have been requesting them and for those new to my programs. I plan to offer lectures and workshops as well, that will focus on the entire Ecstatic Eating! lifestyle; physical, emotional and spiritual. If you have been struggling in your relationship with food, these will be for you.

Please stop into this site; post a new photo if your old one is outdated; update your profile information; and let us all know what draws you to the group and what events you would like to see.

I am also spearheading an Autumn cleanse starting this Monday, October 1st. If you want support around cleansing, this is a community event at no cost. Click on the facebook link below to join:

http://www.facebook.com/#!/events/445766972132219/

Welcome Back or Welcome Forward!

In Health,

Hope Stanger and The Holistic Empiretm
results.name: Ecstatic Eating!tm Raw Foods Meetup of Connecticut

results.description: I have been trading online for 10 plus years now and have just recently moved to Staten Island from Brooklyn. I have a lot of family in Staten Island and I know a lot of traders live here I just don't know too many of them and would like to meet-up with a few more. Also, during my trading career I have found education to be a great way to stay disciplined and focused in a very difficult business. I have also found that there is a lot of education out there but most of it is not very good or is very expensive. I figured that is would be a great way to get together with other traders and to attract some really qualified speakers close to my new home. Hopefully these events attract a lot of trade experienced and new for an Informative Educational Trading Event close to all our homes I look forward to meeting you all, Michael J. Di Gioia

results.description:
The LAW OF ATTRACTION MEETUP GROUP, LI is for people who are interested in learning and practicing the concept of The Law of Attraction. As a group, we learn to attract abundance, prosperity and acquire spiritual insights; manifesting what you want in your life and having gratitude for what you have. In short, it's about the power of positive thinking.

We currently have three to four meetings a month. 

• There is an introductory, informational meeting which is led by Host/Organizer and Certified Coach/LOA Practitioner Helen. 

• "Keep the Vibration Going," a practical meeting with tips and ideas for maintaining and keeping your vibration high. 

• In the general meetings, a topic is chosen pertaining to the LOA and discussed.

• There is also a monthly book series.

• Members can present, or bring a guest speaker in. Contact Helen if you have an idea,  suggestion or someone we would enjoy hearing from!

Learn how to manifest your desires with other like-minded people. Increase your sense of well-being with The Law of Attraction. Welcome!

results.description:
We are a group of local parkour and natural movement practitioners and instructors in New York City. We regularly meetup at varying locations around Manhattan and Brooklyn to train together and learn from one anther.

Parkour is for everyone, regardless of shape, size, and fitness level.  When practiced correctly and consistently, it not only is safe but teaches one how to assess risk, cope with uncertainty, and think creatively.  Our practitioners are called Traceurs.

The primary lead instructors are from the new york community, The Movement Creative, and other community members in the larger NYC and national scene, including the following organizations: ParkourSA, ParkourONE, ParkourVisions, UrbanEvo, AmericanParkour, and RocPK

Also consider joining in on hikes, caving events, rock climbs and lots of other adventures @ http://www.meetup.com/Hikers-and-Cavers/

results.description:
Tired of going to the usual event at a bar and finding yourself with nothing to say--because there's nothing in particular to talk about at just a plain old bar??

Then come on a "Friendly Native New Yorker" Walking Tour!



See the city, learn some fun local history, and meet some new people, all at the same time.

Add a little urban adventure to your weekend by coming along with us.

Native New Yorker Linda is a licensed New York City tour guide (star rated by the Department of Consumer Affairs), has been a docent/educator at both The Merchants House Museum and the Fraunces Tavern Museum, and has led private tours for  The Cooper Union, Bronx Community College, Hostos Community College, New York City College of Technology, and Saint Francis College, and as well as for the Municipal Arts Society's Jane's Walks,  the Northwest Queens Paranormal Research Group, Asian Men/Black Women Connections, and the Society for Eighteenth-Century Music.

All tours are 2-2.5 hours long and cost $20 per person, $15 for seniors 65 or older, with proof of age. Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours. No audio taping or video taping allowed. 

Check out our sister groups for even more adventures: Great Places in Gotham (http://www.meetup.com/The-Great-Places-in-Gotham-Meetup/),  for visiting museums in the city, and my newest group, The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors (http://www.meetup.com/The-Mostly-Bay-Ridge-Neighbors-Meetup/), which focuses on Brooklyn, and Bay Ridge in particular.
results.name: "Friendly Native New Yorker" Walking Tours!

This Singles group is part of a family of 12 single groups totaling over 10,000 eligible and attractive singles from a wide geographic area. We gather at fun and exciting single events which allow us mix and mingle in a relaxed atmosphere with no pressure.

Would you like to discover new places while expanding your social circle, and perhaps even meeting that "special someone" along the way? And all of this while having the time of your life!

Come join a singles group focused on getting out, enjoying a variety of activities, making new friendships and enjoying the company of so many interesting singles. And by the way, if you do meet that special person we encourage you to please keep coming back to our events as a couple. The friendships that are formed here surpass the word "single."

We hope you can join us and have some fun with us,

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

results.description:
Meet single frieinds men and women who are tired of internet connect, bars and the "by chance" to meet friends and people who have similar interests. The goal is to network and create a synergy that allows all of us to meet people who like to be active. Happiness begins with you! Laughing can be infectious, so can sharing yourself and the things you enjoy.  You Have the Power to invite others to get to know you and the things you love to do. What better way to Live the Dream of meeting people than participating in something you always wanted to do but have not taken the time out to do it? Here is your CHANCE, picture it, share it, and make it happen! Make it  fun, make it exciting, facilitate finding people or that someone who share a similar appreciation. You just really might find that person who appreciates the finest nuances of ...fill in the blank_____, your great interest while making friends and having fun in the process.

The Group invites people 40-99+++. Especially those willing to be open to having the best times of their life! Enjoy an eclectic mix of people who appreciate creativity, intellect, humor, positive energy, and others who are willing to embark on a journey of happiness.

Here is the chance to live the dream! Share your ideas of how you can meet others through public venue of your own choosing! Post a suggestion of an event with as much of your idea as possible... then, after three or more people sign-up it becomes and event that all others can share! So go for it! Find happiness!

Please post your ideas, serparately with as much detail as possible! And, not to worry, if somethings are uncertain, people will jump in to help! Once 3 or more people sign up, your idea becomes an event! Please note, this site and this group is dedicated to bringing people together who enjoy social events in the company of others and is NOT to be used for outside commercial purposes.

For identification purposes only, we, ask our members to post a current self-portrait to their profile.
results.name: Happy Active People Meet

results.description:
The TINTED VISION Filmmakers Group is a community for current and aspiring filmmaking professionals of all types who, at the end of the day, want to do one thing:  create great narrative or non-fiction cinematic work.  Whether the format be short films, feature films, web series', music videos, spec commercials, TV pilots, or anything else in between, the goal is to conceive of a project, develop it, and PRODUCE IT. 

 

The unfortunate reality is that many writers and filmmakers come up with great ideas that just never go anywhere. Whether it's because those people lack money, resources, motivation, or confidence, they sadly fall into the category of "Talkers", rather than "Doers". 

 

There are thousands upon thousands of talented and motivated artists in the New York area:  writers, directors, actors, cameramen/women, editors, producers, production designers, composers/musicians, make-up / hair / special fx artists, costume designers, sound-men/women, sound designers…and most of the time, all that's needed to get a project made is a great idea, and the ability to network and get the right people and resources involved to make it happen.

 

Whether you work behind the camera or in front of it; welcome!  We also encourage those on the business side to join us as well:  entertainment lawyers, distributors, potential investors, film or actor reps, festival programmers, line producers…anyone who is motivated and dedicated to helping good cinematic works get made and seen are also warmly welcome.

 

If you have an idea for a project you want to do:  

1. introduce yourself and your project

2. post the script or the outline / treatment for people to see

3. and let's get it made! 

 

And if you have any talents or resources you'd like to offer to either a current or future project, introduce yourself and make yourself known.

 

We'll be setting up a database of this group's members and what they have to offer soon, to help people find each other in a snap.

 

Talking has it's place...Let's *DO*.  And again, welcome to The TINTED VISION Filmmaking Group.
results.name: The TINTED VISION Filmmakers Group

results.description: This group is for VIP ladies.   We will meet new people while enjoying all that life has to offer. Meet other locals in your area to socialize and make new friends. I couldn't find many meetup groups in this area, so I decided to run this group. We can have some fun and get to know each other. Events are held in locations at or near to Middletown, Red Bank, Highlands, Atlantic Highlands, and other towns in Monmouth County. Anyone is welcome to join this group.

Greetings Beautiful Sisters,

Every woman has her own unique Goddess living inside her and every woman needs to connect and open up to her higher and wiser self. We are all truly unique spirits living in bodies who are here to







honor & accept all aspects of ourselves in a circle of love and light with our beautiful sisters!

This Ancient Knowledge and Wisdom has existed for more than 8 thousand years in Ancient India, Egypt and other Civilizations.

For many years it was a Secret Art until now. In this special time of rapid transformation and evolution, we need to practice this tradition more than ever to stay in our power and heal all the parts of ourselves we have been denying for too long.

Each month we will be sharing many important topics, exercises, sacred movement, and techniques for empowerment, self-awareness, self-esteem building, energy balancing, & creative expression to help you







all remember just how special you really are. We all need that reminder now and then, don't we?

I look forward to presenting awe-inspiring speakers, sound healers,educators, & beautiful women who are here to share their knowledge, wisdom, and blessings with us. They will provide the tools for us to make us feel good about who we are & why we are here!

Namaste & Magical Blessings,

Meryl Vandana Brinin
