results.description:
Brooklyn's professional Creative Photography Group <br> See my personal work at </a><a href="http://www.MichaelRobertHartman.com">http://www.MichaelRobertHartman.com

Hello and thanks for taking the 1st step into the lighting world. For the past 15 years I have been working as a top professional lighting tech to professional Fashion, Catalog, Music, and Celebrity photographers from around the world, while also shooting as a professional editorial and advertising photographer. Top mag and print advertising my lighting has been in over the years: Maxim, Stuff, Vogue, Teen People, Macy's, Nordstrom, Italia Moda, Pirates of the Caribbean movie poster, Dr Pepper ads, Gieco ads, two and a half men promos, Elle Mag, Eqsuire mag, Mens health mag, and all of the 2009 Shape Mag pool/ water cover shots just to name a few.

 

 

 

Class details:

Class structure is relaxed, fun, and open forum, which means we all share knowledge together to further our knowledge as a group. You ask, I help you figure it out in a simple solution that makes sense.

In this group I bring together like minded creative photographers. Each session I will cover more topics and different lighting situations hands on with your camera. I supply top of the line Profoto professional lighting gear used by industry professionals around the world. Classes are for beginner up to advanced photographers looking to learn or broaden their lighting skills. I also teach private lighting specific to your needs.

By the end of the class you will be shooting studio lighting outdoors like the pros no mater what skill level you are currently.

Some classes we will have models, others we will take time photographing each other, some events just photographing the world around us.

Thanks again, look for upcoming events and art shows of the groups work.

"Create and play in an artful way"  <br> Quote by: Michael Robert Hartman

 

 

Membership donation:

If you can please add the $10 donation to my group( not mandatory), it is a one time fee, covers supplies, repairs to EQ, light shaping tools, art shows, tracking down sponsors, group trips, emailing people and allowing me to give these classes of such a high value at a low fee, etc...

See my personal work at Http://www.MichaelRobertHartman.com <br> also watch for monthly photo contests from our sponsor: Http://www.YourSportsLife.com <br> I teach real life situations hands on with your camera and my portable studio lighting. 90% of all classes are held outdoors, on the beach. I show back lighting and front lighting, plus one and two light ratios, how and when to use colored gels on the lights, plus standard distance and light height. So put down the books and get to shooting today!!! I will show you insider tips on how and why we use light outdoors. It is easy, once you take my class you will wonder why you waited so long.
results.name: Creative Photography Group

results.description:
What is ALT.NET?

1. You’re the type of developer who uses what works while keeping an eye out for a better way.

2. You reach outside the mainstream to adopt the best of any community: Open Source, Agile, Java, Ruby, etc.

3. You’re not content with the status quo. Things can always be better expressed, more elegant and simple, more mutable, higher quality, etc.

4. You know tools are great, but they only take you so far. It’s the principles and knowledge that really matter. The best tools are those that embed the knowledge and encourage the principles

...then you're in the right place! We will be meeting monthly to discuss issues that interest us in a loose, informal discussion-style environment. All software developers of every stripe are hereby extended an invitation to participate in the discussion or just come and see what all this ALT.NET stuff is about.
results.name: New York ALT.NET Software Development Group

results.description:
We are a New York City-based Asian-American group catering to the youthful and young at heart.  Our group mainly comprises Asian-Americans in their 20s and 30s.  We come together to make new friends, build lasting networks and connections, and enrich our lives through group-oriented events.

Our events cover a large variety of pursuits and activities.  Come join us when it's cold out and we'll explore the hidden indoor gems of our beloved city, from museums, exhibits to shows.  Discover parts of the city which you may never knew existed with new friends, in a casual, relaxed setting.  Before winter-time cabin fever sets in, let's hit the snow and ice with wintery pursuits such as skiing, snowboarding and ice skating.  Have drinks and a meaningful chat with your fellow Asian-American during happy hour.  Meet and get-to-know interesting, fun individuals while having a hearty meal (or two if you're that hungry).  Fill our days with song, dance and music, while soaking in good vibes and celebrating our time together.

When it gets warmer out, let's charge our adrenaline and chase endorphins through active events.  We'll bike around NYC, hike various trails, play various sports, explore different parks, and enjoy the beautiful outdoors together.  Exhilarate, exercise and get healthy with your new-found friends.  And when Mother Nature cranks up the oven, let's hit the beach, work on our tan, take a cool dip in the sea water, and play frisbee, volleyball, football or even fly kites!  Enjoy the sun, surf and warm breeze in company of new friends while solidifying a lifetime of connections and experiences.

This is the New York Young Asian Americans Meetup Group, your place to engage, enrich and enjoy.  Your very own NYYAA.

NYYAA would greatly appreciate donations and sponsors to keep the fun and enrichment going. Thank you for your thoughtfulness!
results.name: ! New York Young Asian Americans Meetup Group

results.description:
We are a Co-Ed pick up Soccer group / league that play soccer for FUN! Our games are outdoors and we play our hometown Long Island City (1 Stop / 3 min from Grand Central), Brooklyn & Manhattan. Beginners, intermediate, & advanced players are all invited to come play.

Why play with us:

  • Each session consists of THREE, 25-30 minute games with a break after each game.
  • Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.
  • Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.
  • It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.
  • We do brunch after our games. Share a laugh, conversation, and have a well deserved mimosa.
  • It's a fun workout outdoors. Get some fresh air.
  • Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games and various locations make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.

 

Where we play:

  • Long Island City - Queens West Sports Field & Murray Playground in Long Island City. (3 minutes from Grand Central).

Want to join our league games? Visit NYC Soccer.com

A home for all acoustic players, singers, and people who like to play unplugged in general. While all levels are welcome, we are an Intermediate to Advanced group.

We currently have two main alternating Meetups:

- One is a "Chord jam" where we all play and sing the same song at once, and the experts get a chance to solo.

- The other is a "Performance Night" where we each take turns playing a song solo or with a friend. These are usually blues, rags, bluegrass, country or also folk/modern, depending.

While the name says "guitar", this group is acoustic in general. There's always room for bass, mandolin, harmonica, tambourine/shakers, keyboards, and so on. Also singers are always welcomed even if you don't play an instrument!

Please check the "Learn more about this Meetup Group" link just below for more details and we hope to see you soon!

Peace,
Chris

results.description:
Meet new people, professionals, students, models, employees, business owners, everyday people!  This is your place!!  Be healthy!  Do something exciting and fun!  Meet extraordinary people!

Experience the magic on the dance floor, something you never thought you'd be doing in a million years...

Dancing represents happiness and celebration in life and is a form of adult recreation and play!

When you tell yourself you have no rhythm and therefore cannot dance, you are expressing that you are somehow not worthy of this spontaneous, creative expression. But of course you are worthy of this opportunity to work with your body to have fun and play! You are just unfamiliar with the territory and hesitate to try it because of a fear of failure. In fact, this is what keeps some people off of the dance floor, because if they were to actually "fail," it may confirm that biggest fear. However, dancing is not about success or failure. It is about confronting your potential to embrace happiness through movement.


The take home message here is that you do, indeed, have rhythm. You just don't want to feel like a fish out of water. This is why so many people are attracted to Dancing With the Stars. The stars, too, are conquering their fears of celebration and expression. Even if, and especially if, you have already proven to be successful in other ways, embarking on learning a new skill like dance can be scary. But you can't fail unless you try, and there is no failure, so.... what are you waiting for? Take a deep breath, and come join us on the floor!

results.description:
This Meetup group was originally founded in 2008 by a handful of German-speaking parents in Astoria. In fall 2012 the group was integrated into the CityKinder network, a community and resources website for German speaking parents in the Tri-State area.

Our purpose is to connect German-speaking parents in the New York Metro area who are interested in socializing with other families and teaching their kids German, as well as providing education and support on a variety of topics concerning international families.

One third of our members reside in Manhattan. Approximately 50% of our families reside in Astoria, Long Island City, Sunnyside or Woodside (all in Queens) or in nearby Greenpoint and Williamsburg (both in Brooklyn). The rest of our members live in Westchester or on Long Island.

Three kinds of parents constitute our membership:

a) Families with one German-speaking parent;

b) Families where both parents are native German speakers, for example expats;

c) Families with German roots or an interest in the German language who don't speak German at all but want their kids to learn German.

Membership in the meet-up confirms acceptance and adherence to the "Meet-up Etiquette," mainly that you and your kids attend meet-ups at your own risk, that you RSVP before attending a meet-up, and that you keep your kids at home in case they are sick. Attendance of any meet up confirms acceptance of the "Activity Release of Liability" posted in the "Pages"-Section on the website of our meet up group. Grown-ups without kids can not attend any meet-up.

Our meet up's are fun, educational, and help parents and kids practice and expand their knowledge of the German language.

Looking forward to meeting you all,

Gabi & CityKinder Team
results.name: CityKinder Queens & Brooklyn

results.description: This is a social group for folks with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder that was intended to meet weekly on Wednesday evenings at 7:00, but has not done so because the members are very nervous, which is understandable. . The intended meeting place was veggie heaven in Teaneck, a vegetarian restaurant. The meeting was meant to be supportive, not dictatorial. Therefore it isn't a 12 step. The tone was set for friendly discussions. possibly there was to be group outings, movies and meals together for those comfortable doing so. if folks cared to discuss past and future treatment, that was to be up to them. Hopefully the group was to meet once a week, but that was not obligatory. There were no fees. The group was to be Non 12 step. The group was intended to be tolerant, but no outright proselytizing please. Those who can't respect others rights to their own spirituality, atheism, agnosticism, Unitarianism, humanism, and any other ism, will be asked to put a lid on it, 5 times. Then offered a very large peanut butter and jelly sandwich with 8 half table spoons of jam and ten huge smears of speech impeding super thick chunky peanut butter, each applied while counting to 10; and their drink will be hidden from them. OCD related movies will be shown at times, when available and will be chosen as a group. please contact me before attending the wednesday meet up. via email through my profile. the group does not always have enough attendies, so it is called off.
results.name: Teaneck/Hackensack Obsessive Compulsive Disorder MeetupGroup

results.description:
Meet Vegans near Teaneck, northern Bergen county. Discuss veganism or the weather. Share your favorite (or least) 'V'ecipes and make, (or offend) new friends. We'll meet at Veggie Heaven in Teaneck, hopefully once a week. after meals there will be board / card games nearby. potlucks, group cooking opportunities, movies, and group video rentals are options. None obligatory. The group welcomes vegans, vegetarians, and raw foodists.
Carnivores / Veggie Curious are welcome, but heckling the herd with yarns of animal targetry will result in C/V/C finding themselves face to face with a table of foaming vegans, many of whom may be animal rights activists, and it is these such circumstances that underscore the ACT in activist.
In the unlikely event that such should transpire, I myself, being a pacifist, will hide under the table.
Seriously, the worst that could happen is someone deviously, inadvertently puts the sizzling tofu platter too close and the heckler gets their eyebrows singed off.
As evident by the intro, the only other prerequisite aside from dietary adherence, is a sense of humor. Those lacking will not be humored.
Here's looking forward to a good humored meal.
results.name: Hackensack / Teaneck  Veggie Vegan Meetup Group

results.description:
Looking for more information about BetaNYC - check out http://Beta.NYC

## What is BetaNYC

BetaNYC envisions an informed and empowered public who can leverage technology, design, and data to address their problems and hold government accountable.

We are dedicated to civic technology, smart communities, & open government. We are a nonpartisan good government community using technology, design, and data to empower individuals and local communities, provides for an honest and efficient government, and build a civically‐engaged ecosystem.

BetaNYC is building a connected NYC, by the people, for the people, for the 21st Century.

## Leadership

    Noel Hidalgo, Executive Director

    Community Leaders & Co-Organizers - Benjamin Arancibia, Emily Goldman, Hayley Richardson, Kara Chesal, Lauren Rennee, Lucio Tolentino, Terrance Beckett, Volkan Unsal, and Yasi Razvan


## Important Community Resources

    • TALK.beta is NYC's online home to civic technology, open data, and open government.

    • The Message - BetaNYC’s weekly Newsletter

    • DATA.beta is NYC’s open data community portal.

    • Projects.beta is a collection of community projects and tools that are helping build a New York City for the 21st century.

    • BetaNYC's Facebook Discussion Group - Facebook’s premier group dedicated to NYC’s civic technology, open data, and open government.

    • Videos of previous events
results.name: #BetaNYC, NYC's open data, open gov, & civic tech community

results.description:
Hi, everyone. The first meetup of the revived Just Write NYC meetup, on Monday, August 10, 2015 at 7 p.m., is to discuss possible formats for Just Write NYC going forward.

Here is the original description, by the original organizers:

"It's a simple concept.  We get together, we write. Bring your notebook, clay tablet, laptop, whatever you write on. We write for thirty-minute stretches with ten-minute breaks.

"Some write fiction, some write memoir, some write encyclopedia entries. It's up to you. There's no pressure to share or critique, but there are opportunities. This is mostly just a way to provide a comfortable environment for writing that's not so lonely. You can write whatever you wish, of course, but there will be writing prompts, if you'd like one.

"All writers, regardless of experience, are welcome."
results.name: Just Write, NYC

results.description:
Kyusho is the study of the weaker anatomical structures of the human body. They are targets that are located on Nervous and Vascular (sometimes both) structures. Because these targets are affecting these systems, we are actually attacking the internal body as opposed to the external structure. The external body was designed by nature to take abuse, from strikes, falls, torn tissue, etc. What it isn't designed or adapted to is attacks on the internal structure and functions, precisely why Kyusho has such devastating and predictable effect.

Learn - Study - Practice Pressure Point Activation

If you are a Martial Artist this will enhance what you know.

If you are not a Martial Artist it is a great way to protect yourself.

Recognized By Kyusho International

$30.00 for Kyusho International Members and $35.00 for Non-Members.

You can sign up for membership before class if you like.

This class covers one (of many) component of T.A.C.T.I.C.S. (other Group) - Pressure Points.

For more information visit www.KyushoNY.com
results.name: Kyusho Pressure Point Class

Thus T.A.C.T.I.C.S. was born!

Under the T.A.C.T.I.C.S. banner are the following courses:

KMA: Korean Martial Arts

FMA: Filipino Martial Arts

CLOSE QUARTER TACTICS - Intensive Course In Empty Hand Combat

KYUSHO - Pressure Point Manipulation

COMBATIVE LOCKS WORKSHOP- Joint Manipulations

KTCP - Kyusho Tactical Control Program (a Kyusho International program)

WAPPP - Women's Awareness and Personal Protection Program

results.description:
OMG NYC (Origami Meetup Group! New York City) is a group for people to come together and share the beautiful art of Origami. Origami is an ancient art of folding various mediums, most commonly paper. Other materials often folded are fabric, wire mesh, sheet metal, tissue, thin plastic, cardboard, and straws. The word comes from the combination of the Japanese verb oru (to fold) and the noun kami (paper).

We meet at least once a month as a big group, to teach each other new models and share paper, books, and tips; also to organize special folding retreats and paper shopping tours in the city. Our regular schedule is every Third Saturday of the month.

Also we have evening after work meetings on Tuesdays and Thursdays evening called WTF (Weekly Tuesday Folders) and AWOL (After Work Origami Lovers) check out the calendar for more details. It's a smaller more intimate group of origami friends that meet to fold fold fold.

We have also added local meetings in Brooklyn (4th Saturdays -BOP - Brooklyn Origami Pals)!

Anyone is welcome! Come AWOL with us! This group is open to folders of all levels, from beginners interested in starting a new hobby to the advanced folder... So Come Join Us & Get Into The fold!!
results.name: OMG NYC (Origami Meetup Group! NYC)

This meetup is made for photographers who want to grow as an Editorial Fashion Photographer. Our workshop and meetup are geared to improve your skills. One Necessary aspect of reviewing your skills is having all the right elements (High Fashion Models, Makeup, Hair, and Quality Wardrobe). Without these elements your images will be taken to the next level. We work in a small groups to make sure we get enough time to work and improve our skills. We carefully select locations to shoot and always have a theme for each shoot, so that you get a great editorial skills. We also go over various fashion editing techniques to help you improve the end product. Please note because of the quality and the cost involved in securing the right models, team, and locations, the rate for our meet up ranges from $125 - $200. If you are not able to afford this meet up, then this group is not for you. Thank you, Max

results.description:
Because "pick-up" soccer implies that you can just show up and get in a game, we've called this "sign-up" soccer - to ensure that people with busy schedules can reserve a spot in a planned but still casual game. We don't allow "walk-ins" unless numbers happen to be short.

In addition to the above, here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes.

• Excellent equipment: $145 balls, and square, sturdy goals (not flimsy, circular pop-ups).

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft bibs.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't often make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team.

• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools, which don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming.

See nyisl.com for more info. about our program for under-served public school students.

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment).

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc.

If you have any of the above gear, please bring it along to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

Please remember to RSVP (and to change your RSVP if your plans change). If you show up without signing up, you may find the game full. If you sign up and don't show up (thereby causing the game to have uneven numbers, or worse - making it so that there aren't enough people for a game), then you'll be swiftly shown the exit!

And PLEASE TAKE NOTE: If you like to moan and wine at others because you don't think they've made a good enough pass, this isn't the game for you. This game is for those who want a positive, welcoming experience! If you want a venue for getting out your aggression - or for showing off - there are plenty of typical pick-ups out there!

Hope to see you out there soon!
results.name: "Sign Up" Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
The aim of this meetup is to bring together people who live in the New York City area who have an interest in the Myers Briggs Type Indicator in a mellow, non-structured environment where they can get to know the 16 types. These types are: INFP, ENFP, INFJ, ENFJ, INTP, ENTP, INTJ, ENTJ, ISFJ, ESFJ, ISFP, ESFP, ISTP, ESTP, ISTJ, ESTJ. 

This group started out with a focus on INFP's only, but that was rather narrow, and the meetups were found to be ultimately more rewarding if any and all of the 16 types could interact.

These meetups are intended to be non-structured, informal and allow for maximum interaction between members. However, those who wish and feel qualified to give a presentation on a relevant topic, are welcome to schedule it in advance by contacting the organizer. Members frequently talk about subjects besides MBTI. The main topic of this Meetup serves more as a starting point for discussion rather than as an end in itself. People are free to mingle and talk with whomever they find interesting. All personality types are equally welcome. This is the place to be if you'd like to socialize with people who share an awareness of the importance of personality.
results.name: The New York City MBTI Meetup Group

“The mountains are calling and I must go." -- John Muir

Join us for The Next Adventure - it could be hiking, backpacking, day hiking, trekking, rock and ice climbing, camping, snowboarding, skiing, backcountry snowboarding and skiing, alpine skiing, backcountry skiing and snowboarding. Alpine snowboarding and freeride snowboarding, snowshoeing, cross country skiing, alpine climbing, snow climbing, ice climbing, mixed climbing, mountaineering and we also do kayaking, canoeing, whitewater rafting, telemark skiing, sailing, paddling, bicycling, mountain biking, ice skating, night hiking, thru-hiking etc. during warmer seasons and anything sounds fun for outdoors adventurers.

There are so many great adventures ahead - let's go!
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

The Next Adventure and Hiking's activities may involve certain risks in our outdoor adventures such as hiking, backpack, rock and ice climbing, kayaking, rafting and other adventures. Read our About Us page for full disclaimer and you must post a profile photo of yours to be accepted as a member.

Some of our backpacking, hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, ski, snowboarding, sailing, rafting, kayaking and other outdoor adventurous trips are strenuous so be physically fit to participate in the those trips and you are expected to have necessary gear for the activities. You may need hiking and backpacking gear such as hiking boots, hiking or backpacking packs, hiking poles & hiking maps, hiking food & hiking headlamps to participate our hiking or other outdoors trips.

Please use our Message Board for hiking, ski, snowboarding plans, hiking or climbing tips, hiking, ski, info and hiking climbing, ski, snowboard gear as well as find hiking, climbing, ski snowboarding or ride-sharing partners & adventurers. You can also find INFO on hiking, backpacking, climbing, ski, snowboarding, kayaking, sailing and other activities in the Files section.

As our group grows fast we need additional hiking, kayaking, ski, rock climbing and other trip leaders. As a hiking or a trip leader you must be physically above average fit, responsible and relatively experienced in leading hiking or other trips.

Due to the unique nature of the rock and ice climbing activities we created a sister group "Rock & Ice" that focuses uniquely on climbing: http://www.meetup.com/Rock-n-Ice/

See you on our NEXT ADVENTURE!

results.description:
Meet other people who enjoy board games at our creative work space in the Flatiron District, next to Madison Square Park, home of the famous Shake Shack.

Types of Games:
Pictionary
Scategories
Scrabble
Boggle
Apple to Apples
Charades
Cranium

And more… we're open to suggestions!

When: We are meeting once a month, though depending on the group we would like to meet bi-monthly.

What makes our group different: Our group is more of a way for people to relax after work and interact in a light, fun, social environment. We've all seen the not-so-nice side of people come out when playing in teams in games like Pictionary, so we've decided to get rid of the teams and most of the rules.  This is how it would work if we were playing Pictionary: Each player gets a card and then each player takes a turn drawing in order around the table. You get rewarded for drawing well; you get rewarded for guessing well. When someone guesses the answer, both the drawer and the guesser get a point. Everyone is involved, everyone is happy!
results.name: After-work Board Game Club

results.description:
Wellness. Arts. Community.....the Smart Party...Meet a very intriguing, open -minded,  diverse group.. who are committed to an alcohol free lifestyle. Gather to participate in social activities, such as after work parties, dances, meeting in cafes, tea salons, yoga, dance studios. Make friends with people who don't need to drink to have a good time. 
Fabulous way for artists, musicians, singers, actors, models, photographers and other creative talents to showcase their work at our unique, multi-media venues. Our goal is to provide society with an exciting, upbeat alternative to the bar scene. We "party on a higher plane..." at our mocktail socials ( our signature event)....

Artistic...Holistic..Altruistic...Global..Sensual..Social..Creating alcohol-free alternatives..to give future generations a CHOICE.. The Smart Party is a new, exciting,  hip yet  healthy yet glamorous..party scene, in New York City...

It is a community of individuals who choose to  exist on a higher vibration,  naturally, sans drugs...by mindful living...who wish to explore their sacred Selves, through creativity....

who honor their bodies....

seek spiritual growth....

are from all backgrounds/races....who respect and wish to explore our connection to each other...and

enjoy Healthy Pleasures!

The Smart Party is the original alcohol free meetup group....seems to be a few more, started by people who have liked my idea so much, they copied it, & started their own version.  We're "conscious creatives"...a name that reflects much respect for those who join...

This is not a sobriety/recovery group, or a "singles" group.....or one that targets just 20 and 30 year olds....

it is open to all adults over 21 who don't require liquid drugs in order to enjoy life....

I thank you for your interest and support of alcohol free social venues.

Best,

Lynn Earley/Organizer
results.name: Smart Party NYC's #1  Alcohol Free Social Network

results.description:
Our mission is to create a group of people who love to dance tango and make friends.

Our school has one of the most friendly environments in tango. It is free of attitude and is the perfect place to meet new friends. Singles find the opportunity to meet other singles and couples rediscover their relationship. This is also the right place for social networking to create new businesses.

As a group, we all go out together for social dancing and we create several events where every one (beginners and not beginners) have fun

You will never have to dance alone!

Signing up for this group you will find information on all the exciting events from our tango dance school in New York City. Information on upcoming classes, special workshops, film lectures, practicas, shows, etc.

Why we are special?

The Strictly Tango NYC school is exclusively dedicated to spreading authentic classical tango as it was danced in Argentina during the Golden Age of Tango from the 1940s to the 1980s. Our teaching system is based on many years of research we did on location in Buenos Aires and all over the world.

Our school uses 100% traditional tango techniques. This is the pure neighborhood style with no influences from other dances. Our aim is to form strong and clear leaders, and sharp and precise followers with elegance, posture and creativity.

Don't hesitate and join us now.

Sergio
Director
www.learnargentinetango.com

results.description:
Have you always wanted to know what it's like to be an Actor?  Are you uncertain about your ability to be an Actor.  Why not give Acting a try?

The Carl Velas ACTING STUDIO simulates a complete theatrical environment through the development of short Dramatic scenes.  Each meeting begins with an initial cold reading and ends with a final staged presentation.  Weekly meetings are held in Northern Manhattan, on Saturdays from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

All classes are FREE.

See sample of videos taken from prior meetings of this group:

www.youtube.com/user/CarlVelas1

 

SPECIAL NOTE:  (1) This group is designed for beginners to Acting.  (2) Members must be physically able to move quickly back and forth to the performance area. (3) Members must be able to read and speak the English language fluently. (4) Members must be at least 18 years old.  (5) Members must attend at least one meeting of this group. (6) Members must agree to have class performances filmed and placed on YouTube.

DISCLAIMER:  This group is not meant to replace traditional Actor preparation received by attending an accredited, licensed, professional Acting School or by studying with a qualified private Acting coach.  Also, this group cannot assist you in finding employment in the entertainment industry.
results.name: The Carl Velas ACTING STUDIO

results.description:
Do you like going out for drinks but cringe when you see the bar occupied by college students and hipsters? Are you looking to meet your people within your age range? You've come to the right group! 

We are a group of people (mostly Gen X-ers and late baby boomers) between the ages of 30-50. We have been organizing these monthly happy hours since April 2003. One Friday a month, we go to various bars in Manhattan as well as the occasional Saturday. We also visit bars in the outer boroughs (during the summer). From time to time, we'll do other things, i.e. concerts, movies, and dinners. 

This group is private, subject to approval so if you are interested in joining we require the following: 

1) That you are between the ages of 30-50 (obviously) 

2) A current picture of yourself (no pics of cartoons, celebrities, images,  pets, etc) 

3) Answer the questions (more than 1 word answers) we have posted. 

Furthermore, we do ask that members RSVP for our Meetups, so no flakers, please! Even if you can't attend an event, please give us the courtesy of letting us know. 

Thank you for your interest in our group! Doug, Kristin, and Marjorie

results.description:
This is a group for Third Culture Kids (TCKs) and Cross Culture Kids (CCKs) in the New York City area. 

The goal of this group is to  build a  TCK/CCK community in one of the most international cities in the world.  It hopes to become a space to share our stories, celebrate our global identities, discuss our experiences of growing up between worlds, meet new people, and have some fun.


-- What is a Third Culture Kid?
 

An individual who, having spent a significant part of the developmental years in a culture other than their parents’ cultures, develops a sense of relationship to all of the cultures while not having full ownership in any. Elements from each culture are incorporated into their life experiences, but their sense of belonging is in relation to others of similar experience. -- David C. Pollock


-- What is a Cross Culture Kid?

A person who has lived in—or meaningfully interacted with—two or more cultural environments for a significant period of time during developmental years. - Ruth E. Van Reken


Please visit out website at http://nycthirdculturekids.wordpress.com/

Please forward you questions to nycthirdculturekids@gmail.com
results.name: New York City Third Culture Kids

results.description:
The Appalachian Mountain Club (“AMC”) is one of the oldest outdoors groups in the United States.  We offer activities for all types and levels of outdoor enthusiasts, including hiking, backpacking, rock climbing, mountaineering, kayaking, bicycling and more!

AMC has 12 regional chapters in the Northeast region that stretch from Maine to Washington, D.C.  The New York-North Jersey Chapter is the second largest with over 12,000 members.  We have over 100,000 members nationally. 

Young Members (“YM”) is an affinity group within AMC for members in their 20’s and 30’s.  YM holds monthly outdoors events (e.g., day hikes, camping trips, kayaking trips) and a happy hour on every third Thursday of the month (“Thirsty Third Thursdays”).  A few times a year, we hold inter-chapter events with YM groups from the 11 other chapters in our organization.

If you’re interested in the outdoors and are looking to make new friends, then please come to one of our events.  Please note that we’re open to everyone, including “non-members”!

LINKS:

Official Website

Facebook Group

Flickr Page 

Wikipedia Page

AMC NY-NoJ Meetup Page
results.name: Appalachian Mountain Club - Young Members

results.description:
Welcome to Women's World of Boxing!

Reasons Why You Should Join This Meetup:

#1. You intend at some point in your life to learn how to box...for real.

#2. You want to learn how to box with real women who welcome you regardless of your size, age, culture, fitness level and occasionally do cool stuff outside of the gym.

#3. You support women owned business and women boxing trainers who create a hassle free environment for you to learn how to box...for real.

If you're still reading, here is a little about your organizer...

My name is Teresa "Reese" Scott and I am the Founder of Women's World of Boxing, NYC. I am a Licensed and Registered USA Boxing Coach, a Personal Motivational Boxing Trainer, Entrepreneur and Author. I have trained in group and private sessions, over 1,000 women, girls, and celebrities of all ages and fitness levels.

I created this meetup to bring women together in a less intimidating, positive, safe, empowering, supportive, uplifting environment to explore the sport of BOXING FOR REAL. I do not teach cardio and/or fitness boxing which is why I DO NOT TAKE WALK-INS.

I was introduced to boxing twelve years ago when I was looking for a way to get in shape and shed some of my 215 pounds. Through the sport, I found confidence, my voice, developed inner-strength and lost over 60 pounds.

My love of the sweet science along with my total body transformation led to me leaving my 18 year career in publishing, and choosing my mission which is to open the first "Real Deal" women only boxing gym in NYC. (side note: nyc is ridiculously expensive so if you are or have a rich aunt who would be interested in investing, email me at: reese@wwboxing.com) Feel free to come by with or without your aunt to see what we're about!

Women's World of Boxing has grown over the years and has been featured in: Refinery29, amNewYork, Small Business Opportunities, Self.com, ESPNW, DailyCandy.com, Juicy Magazine, Body Plus Magazine, Competitor Magazine, wellandgoodnyc.com, Blackenterprise.com, YRMRK.com, SheSeek.com, The New York Daily News, Madame Noire, DNAinfo.com, SHAPE Magazine, GO! Magazine and on CNBC, WPIX11 and TLC'S What Not to Wear.

To get started, log on to http://womensworldofboxing.com/ Regardless of any prior mixed martial arts, kickboxing and/or boxing training, everyone must complete our 'Boxing Mechanics' before training with WWB.

Women's World of Boxing welcomes you to the new world of women's boxing and encourages you to follow us on:

http://twitter.com/womnsworlofboxn

http://www.facebook.com/WWBoxing

http://www.pinterest.com/womnsworlofboxn/

http://wwbny.spreadshirt.com/

On Instagram: WWBCoach

results.description:
We have change this group from the original purpose of energetic healing to a new effort we are now creating call The New Earth Society. The purpose of this new effort to help people recognize that we are the creators of our own world and if we want to see a more compassionate world exist, it must start with us! We will get together periodically to discuss and share all the different ways we can be more compassionate in our own lives - in our relationships, our careers, our families, etc. - and by doing so we help to affect those around us in a positive manner and be the pebble dropped in a still lake of water that ripples out far and wide.

Our meetings will not be a "class" in the traditional sense, but more an exploration where everyone can participate and contribute what it means to be more compassionate to them. We will open our meetings with a short meditation, start discussing one particular theme for meetings, and have everyone present contribute in whatever manner they prefer. We may end up with more questions than answers, but they will be a better quality of questions!

So please join us in helping to create The New Earth that so many people have been talking about. It is up to us to see it through...

results.description: Meet with other local Motorcyle Riders! Gather to plan rides -- long and short. Discuss riding tips and more! This is a riding group who enjoys meeting new people and the sport of motorcycling. We are family oriented and all are welcome. We like to think of ourselves as "Weekend Warriors". Rides start from Oak Ridge, NJ . Rides are posted on the Calendar. Take a look and see if anything sounds like something you would like to do. As our group gets larger and experience level vary, I have to remind myself not to assume everybody knows the rules etc... or even what KSU (Kick Stands Up and we are moving) stands for, and I find myself doing that all the time. I appreciate all questions, and hey! what the heck are we doing comments that are thrown my way. For those who are new to the group, I'll go over some general things that I assume everyone know :).... First about upcoming rides, I'll watch the weather closely and I will make a determination if possible by Wednesday the week of the ride. If it's obvious that the weekend is going to be a total wash out I'll cancel the ride on Meetup. Be sure to check the site often. If Saturday looks like a better day to go riding due to weather than Sunday, I'll post that also on Meetup. If I haven't posted anything, we are going on the day I posted. If there is a slight chance of rain, please pack your rain gear. We'll go slow or pull over undercover if we get caught in a passing downpour. It's important that I have your cell numbers and you can email me if I don't exchange mine before we go for last minute stuff that may happen or the ride gets cancel. If we get to the meetup place and it's starts raining, I'll get a feel from the group what they want to do. Ride or Cancel. I'm one for taking chances the weather will be good. I really dislike sitting at home because the weather man says it's going to rain and I don't see a drop all day. It tends to really bum me out :). We typically stop throughout the ride and for sure every 100 miles for gas. I've attached a link about group riding that pretty much describe our riding group style. Please take a moment to read the General Group Riding to include, positioning, passing, group behavior and an alternate to route sheets and remember SAFETY is number one. http://www.motorcyclesafety.state.mn.us/lat...
results.name: NJ Weekend Warriors Motorcycle Meetup Group

results.description:
This group was formerly known as NYC - Happy Ex-JW Survivors Meetup. We are currently undergoing some changes? Why? Well we will still keep JW and related tags connected to this group for search purposes. But we have found that one of the big needs exJWs or ex-anything for that matter is interaction was a wide variety of people. Integration into society is essential. So there is room here for small events incorporating one denomination as well as larger ones for several denominations.

It should be noted that this is a secret group, only for formerly religious people living in the NYC area. We will be pre-screening members. Again the purpose of this group is for socializing and getting our respective ex-religious groups (or all of us) together for events, while at the same time maintaining some privacy for those who may need it.

Formerly Religious is for people who have left their religions, especially fervently religious, fundamentalist, and orthodox sects. This group is designed for people who no longer believe in the faith they were raised in, such as Christianity, Islam, Judaism, and Hinduism; i.e. atheists, agnostics, and deists or “spiritual” individuals who may or may not believe in a higher power. We think we are going to find a lot of commonality, and find support around our shared challenges. This is a group for socialization, discussion, friendship, and fun (but not proselytizing). If you think you are a fit, please join us!  Please Note: This group is NOT for supporters or the curious.  We are trying to create a community of people with similar backgrounds.  Thank you for understanding...

We can learn from both the similarities and differences in our backgrounds and the challenges faced by those leaving our religious groups and the communities within those groups. Also, there may be organizations which serve the needs of the ex-religious across religions, since we face so many common challenges; struggles with family and making new friends, divorces and custody disputes, stunted educations, overcoming indoctrination, gay rights, etc.

We might also at some point be able to work together on political or legislative issues which concern us all.

A few things: (1) Please only post things in this group which are relevant to everyone in this group. That would include anything of interest to ex-religious people in NYC generally or anything an ex-religious group is doing which is open to all of us. If a group has a meeting and it only for that group, please do not post here, because people might mistakenly think it is an open meeting. If you are just posting a general interest story, it's probably better to post in the large Formerly Religious group with over 1,000 members:https://www.facebook.com/groups/FormerlyReligious/ (note: that group is closed, not secret, and while problematic members are removed, people are not pre-screened before they are let in).

(2) If you know someone who left an orthodox/fundamentalist faith living in the NYC area who would like to join us, please add them. If the moderators of this group do not know the person personally, they may inquire about the person. PLEASE DON'T ADD ANYONE YOU HAVE NOT MET IN PERSON, regardless of how well you think you know them in cyberspace. We are trying to keep this group as secure as possible, and it is impossible to really know the identity of people nobody has meet offline.

(3) It is of course vital that everyone keep this group's membership, events, and posts secret.

(4) Please don't leave us! This is a unique group, and while we're not yet sure what we are going to do with the group, some good things should happen. One person has already contacted me about doing a panel of ex-religious people from different religions. If there are a lot of posts in this group and you find them distracting, please just choose the option to remove them from your feed. On the other hand, if there isn't much happening here, don't assume nothing is going to happen... Thanks for your patience!

Isaac Carmignani
Todd Kadish
results.name: Formerly Religious NYC

results.description:
RUSA LGBT is a network for Russian-speaking LGBTQ individuals, their friends, and supporters. RUSA LGBT has welcomed many LGBT asylum seekers from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Kazakhstan, who fled the abuse and mistreatment in their homelands. RUSA LGBT regularly organizes cultural and social events to unite Russian-speaking LGBTQ community in America and to increase acceptance and inclusion of LGBTQ people within the Russian-speaking public. RUSA LGBT advocates for social justice, human and civil rights for LGBTQ people in America and in the former Soviet Union. RUSA LGBT was founded in 2008. RUSA LGBT mobilized over 200 Russian-speaking people to join the Pride March in NYC in 2013 and 2014 with a protest against Russian homophobic laws.

We welcome everyone who has ties to the Russian-Speaking LGBTQ community to join our group and support our cause.  

Most of our meetups take place in New York City. We often venture out to New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania. Our members live in different parts of the US and some visit us from other countries.


Come and meet with other Russian-Speaking LGBTQ people. Bring along your family, friends and significant others. Let's get together, hang out, share our stories, have fun and create a Russian-Speaking LGBTQ community along the way. We are single, we are couples, we are parents, we are children, sisters and brothers - we are just like you!

 Tell us a few words about yourself. Our approval process is quick and easy. We are a very friendly bunch and our meetups are a lot of fun. 


Go ahead and join us.  We hope to meet you soon!

We also invite you to join us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/rusa.lgbt

and follow us on twitter @RUSALGBT.
results.name: RUSA LGBT - Russian-Speaking LGBTQ Meetup

results.description: We plan to have regular social gatherings, so you can make friends, enjoy uninhibited feminist conversation, and most importantly casually discover issues you share as women in NYC and the ways that we might solve them. We hope these purely social gatherings will foster camaraderie, wild brainstorming, and inspire subsequent events and actions. NOW has always been a grassroots organization that relies heavily on its almost completely autonomous local offices. Those offices, like NOW-NYC, are offices of local activists. As a member of NOW (and by extension this group), our role is to identify issues confronting feminism locally, plan how to solve them, and execute the plan. Repeat. We are meant to be our own activists. And we are meant to be creative! Our general mission will always stay dynamic--it will change with you. But as these informal socials and the formal meetings that follow them proceed, we will develop a specific mission and set of strategies, which we will update all the time. We'll also always keep you informed of official NOW and NOW-NYC news and events. We encourage all of you to join offical NOW-NYC committees. We can do a lot together. So keep your ear to the ground, sisters!
results.name: The NOW-NYC Meetup Group

Bayshore Writers is a gathering of creative writers from Central and Northern Jersey, the Jersey Shore and beyond. We are dedicated to offering each other support, encouragement, interaction, feedback, stimulation, and an ongoing, comfortable expressive outlet.

Anyone who is currently engaged in creative writing or has "that idea" she/he wants to realize is welcome! We are not restricted by genre or form. Our focus is imaginative writing, but that certainly includes creative non-fiction as well.

At our monthly meetings, we discuss our writing progress, set goals, and then engage in some kind of imaginative writing exercise (eg. writing from prompts).

Additionally, there are also form or genre specific meetings. For example, we have a group of screenwriters who meet on a bi-weekly basis and are making excellent progress on their projects. We can have short story meetings, poetry, novel, etc. Any member can suggest an additional focused meeting.

results.description:
If you love to play racquetball, but can’t find a court or some friendly games to get going, welcome to the club.

New York City has proven to be a tough place for racquetballers.  Seems there are a lot of us who want to play – but there is very little in terms of local organization and even fewer places to get a court.  So having little to no options, I decided to create the NYC Racquetball Meetup group to get something going. 

This group is intended to be a starting point to growing an NYC-based racquetball community where people can self-organize games, events and get information.   We will start with quarterly ladders, and then hopefully add in pick-up game nights and round-robin tournaments once the group grows.   Who knows, maybe we can add a little social element to this as well.  

So get in on the action! Join for fun, or if you are joining for competition or for a ladder, please mention that specifically in your intro, or separate email.  See first meetup for details -- Paul
results.name: The New York City Racquetball Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is for those traumatized by a sociopath in their life. The aim is to help support one another, listen, sympathize and offer resources.  Because of a relationship with a sociopath you may have gone through similar lies, betrayal and emotional abuse.  The lack of remorse and the level of manipulation is unlike any other most have experienced.  If this rings true to you, please take the initiative to start conversations, connect with one another and support each other through online and offline meetings.

 

It has been found that surprisingly 1/25 is a sociopath. Sociopaths leave behind many destroyed hearts, minds and lives without conscience, remorse or regret. A support system is needed to help those who were affected by a sociopath, recover. This group was started for those affected by Joe Tong, a corporate lawyer who has lived in Vancouver, CA, NYC, Shanghai, Singapore, Hong Kong, (in case any of his new girlfriends have Googled him and landed here).

organizer.name: fell in love with a sociopath

results.name: JOE TONG sociopathy support

results.description:
Are you interested in corporate social responsibility (CSR), sustainability, and ethical business? Are you a professional in this field, blogger, student, academic or supporter? Do you want to learn more, explore new ideas, start or boost a career in this field? Then our Meetup group is for you!
Join and become an active member by attending our events and networking with other professionals who share your interest in CSR. We develop opportunities to learn and get inspired, present and showcase ideas and projects, discover information about the goings on in the field, and obtain valuable peer review and feedback. We consciously do not charge for membership and do our best to keep our events free of charge. This allows a wider audience to explore and experience CSR, a key aspect we believe is highly important to this emerging field.

The New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup Group is a professional organization which offers its members an open community for learning and networking with other professionals who share an interest in corporate social responsibility, sustainability and corporate citizenship. We develop events and opportunities to learn and get inspired, present and showcase ideas and projects, discover information about the goings on in the field, and obtain valuable peer review and feedback. Membership is free and accessible by signing up on our meetup.com Web site. 

Currently, we offer members two opportunities to connect with others in this field - through our CSR Connect and Insight Tuesdays events, both structured to allow for networking before and after the evening program. CSR Connect (formerly CSR Socials) events were formed to educate and connect members with each other while gaining an understanding of the impact various organizations have in the field. Select corporate social responsibility professionals present on their area of expertise as we listen and ask questions. Insight Tuesdays is a kind of book club for professionals - we read and meet up to discuss CSR literature such as chapters of CSR books, white papers, articles, reports and studies as well as view webinars, instructional videos and other media, across all categories of the industry. To obtain the documents for each month's readings (free of charge), go to the "More" tab on our Meetup page and then click "Files."

Visit and join our groups on Facebook and LinkedIn.
results.name: The New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup Group

results.description:
Promotion Sizzle and Dazzle for Sales Success Club.

 

Join Us With ONE EASY Click -

All Profile Questions are Optional!

 

 

 

We know that competition is steep in every arena of business!

That's a given today, because your competition is no longer the guy in the next cubicle who wants the same promotion you want, the woman who answers the same classified ad you respond to, or the business promoter who is selling similar products or services that you are promoting.

The reality is that your competition resides world-wide.

Because of the Internet and the reach that social media creates, it's global. It's massive. It's ever expanding. Once that's understood, it's becomes easier to build the tools, strategies and empower yourself with practical knowledge that beats the competition so you can come out a winner, sooner and faster!

To successfully sell yourself, or your products and services today, you must be pretty awesome to beat the competition. You must as they say, not only sell the steak, but foremost the sizzle. You must be clear about what you want and how you'll go about getting it.

You must be creative and strategic: You must be willing to dazzle them with what uniquely sets you apart!

This Meetup is dedicated to providing you with opportunities to shape, and sustain your unique selling abilities through networking, social events, learning and support to reach and build a bigger, stronger and lasting network with the right skills that are useful today, not yesterday.

Hope to see you at our next Meetup!

Zorka Kovacevich

Meetup Organizer

results.description:
Meet other New York City Stay At Home Dads, Part-time at home dads, work from home dads, freelance dads, working dads, and involved fathers in and around NYC to socialize and interact with other guys who enjoy spending quality time with their kids during the day.

Our primary goal is to form an inclusive & active community of involved dads so we can do activities together and take advantage of the wonderful resources that the city has to offer.

Organized meet up events are offered several times per week at a local park, playground, museum, playgym, children's venue, parent & me class, zoo, restaurant, or someone's playroom/lounge in their building.

There are not enough resources, support groups, or services for dads in NYC. This group is the pioneer in achieving more for dads in NYC and the surrounding NY Metro area including Jersey City, Long Island, and lower Westchester!

Additionally, check out our BLOG SITE to read about playgroup experiences, relevant news articles, upcoming events and happenings, research, work-life balance, tips for new and expectant dads, and more from a diverse group of dad voices: http://www.nycdadsgroup.com/

Join us on Facebook:  http://www.facebook.com/NYCDadsGroup

Join us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/NYCDadsGroup

Expectant father? We now offer a practical & hands-on workshop for expectant fathers - New Dad Boot Camp: http://www.nycdadsgroup.com/p/new-dad-boot-camps.html

The NYC (New York City) Dads Group is the flagship member of the City Dads Group national organization. City Dads Group has communities of dads in other major metropolitan cities such as NYC, Boston, Philly, L.A., San Francisco, Denver, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Indy, St. Louis, Portland, and Columbus. If you have any fatherly friends who live within a 100-mile radius of any of the City Dads Group cities, please let them know about these other Dads Groups and encourage them to join.

Finally, we have a $25/year suggested donation to join our Meetup group. This amount is less than the cost of a single kid's class in NYC, but collectively, the money will be used to reach out to more dads around the city, participate in more parent expos, & continue to use our voice to bring the privilege of active fatherhood to all dads. Contribute here: http://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Dads-Meetup-Group/dues/

** Please note this group is strictly for Dads with kids. We want this group to be a comfortable place for Dads to learn and talk about anything parent related.
results.name: New York City (NYC) Dads Meetup Group

results.description:
Come dance your way fit with us in our beautiful newly renovated  900sq ft. dance studio located in downtown Cranford, near Westfield, Elizabeth, Roselle and Plainfield, Springfield, and Union  NJ.  Ample parking available  in rear of building. We are located in the lower level. Bus and train station one block walking distance.

Back to Basics Beginner Belly dance technique  and Combo classes. Come  explore the mystery of Belly dance. Which muscles to contract to create the isolation's we adore. Each week we focus on a different element of the dance, hip bumps, undulations, Pelvic and chest circles, figure 8's and more then we drill, drill, drill. With practice the muscles get stronger and the movement become sharper and more defined. Each class ends with a simple dance movement combination that is easy to follow and transition. This class is a workout, you will tone your legs, glutes and shoulders. Your posture will improve and you will carve out a more defined beautiful feminine midsection. Join us in a safe, supportive environment and unleash your inner goddess.

 

If you need a regenerating workout come and try our yoga basic class. Through asanas (physical poses) and breathing exercises you will increase flexibility, tone  muscles while reducing stress and fatigue.  Come and get started on developing a personal yoga practice.

We now offer Tribal Fusion Belly Dance, Veil Technique and Burlesque 101 Too!

 

Please call Sharon at 908-370-8882 or visit our  website at  www.sharonfit.com
results.name: Sharon Fit Belly Dance & Group Fitness Studio

results.description: We are a large, friendly, and diverse group of parents. This group is designed to explore the ways in which social media and technology can help bring arts and culture to the masses. "Democratizing" the arts has been a long-standing goal in the art world, and no medium makes it more feasible than the web.

The purpose of this meetup is to bring together those working at the intersection of arts and technology to share ideas, strategies, successes, challenges and failures, and to explore the following questions:

-   How can the new technology available help raise awareness about the arts and enrich the audience experience?

-   How can cultural institutions interact and engage with each other and their audience in meaningful ways?

-   What can they learn from their audience and how can they use this knowledge to improve the way in which they present their content?

-  As well as countless others that we hope to uncover at future meetups!

results.description:
Discover Calm, Reclaim your Sanity, Restore your Body!

Using yoga breathing and meditation techniques, and exercises, you'll finally be comfortable again in your body and mind.

Hi. My name is Amanda and I'm a Yoga Alliance Certified Yoga Instructor and owner of Revolution Yoga in Rockville Centre. With a deep understanding of energetic principles, various anatomical and physiological situations and health in general, my teachers and I get great results for our students.

By practicing with us you will be safely guided through poses with attention to you and your specific needs.
"Just as your fingerprints are different than anyone elses in the world, yoga stretches and exercises you do need to be personalized to have the maximum effect."-Varona

Every student I work with is on his or her own journey to reach unique goals in unique bodies.

The most important point to be made about yoga!:
Yoga is for everyone! It doesn't matter if you can't remember the last time you worked out or even if you're convinced you can't get back into good shape, lose weight or increase your flexibility. Yoga can work for you!

Students typically report an amazing list of physical benefits including: their blood pressure decreasing, flexibility and balance increasing, posture improving, ability to sleep improving, sexual drive improving, strength and energy levels increasing, their immune system getting stronger, and weight normalizing.

Even more remarkably, if you have dis-ease in the body, whether it be health, injury, or age related, yoga has been scientifically proven to aid your body in naturally healing itself. Many physical therapists suggest yoga being well aware of its healing power.

People come to yoga for many different reasons, to heal an injury, lose weight, gain strength, flexibility, coordination, or peace of mind. Whatever your reason you'll be sure to gain many benefits from a regular yoga practice!

YES, you will relieve stress, restore your sense of awe, and find balance in life!

YES, you will gain flexibility, strength and a renewed sense of well-being!

YES, you will tap into a deep and confident self-awareness!

YES, you will have more energy, motivation and focus!

By practicing with us, you'll find your transition into a regular practice occurs quickly and safely which allows you to go deeper and learn profound things about yourself!

Classes can range from sweaty and physical, to calming and meditative. Either way I will navigate you through a class that will bring you towards optimal balance in the body and mind.
All sessions will end with 10 minutes of relaxation poses and gentle thai yoga adjustments in relaxation poses

However our paths join, We'd be so honored to take part in your journey!
results.name: Nassau County Yoga + Meditation Meetup

results.description:
Did you know it was native son Washington Irving who first dubbed New York City “Gotham”, a century before a certain superhero and his crime-ridden hometown were even thought of? Yes, Gotham is our city, our hometown, whether by birth or adoption! So let’s see the sites that make Gotham aka New York City so unique in the world. We go to exhibits and concerts at museums and unusual venues in the city, some famous, like the Metropolitan Museum, and others a little more off the beaten track, like the Merchant’s House Museum. Whether large or small, they’re all New York—come on along with us on the journey!

Our event size is intentionally smaller for two reasons. First, it's so that all of us in attendance can interact and get to know each other. Second, lecture or film events at these venues usually have very limited seating, meaning I have to get there early and hold the number of seats we need, often against very aggressive people. That means we really need to have an accurate count for our rsvps, especially since our events almost always have a waiting list. If for whatever reason after you have rsvp'd yes, your plans change and you cannot attend, please change your rsvp as early as possible both so that those on the waiting list can get a seat at an event, and so I know when all attendees are assembled and can relax my stance against "aggressors". Also, because the total number of rsvps is so small, on most events there will not be an option to bring a guest. This is because some no-shows had "guests", which really cut into attendance. Tell your friends to sign up as members themselves if they want to come!

Similar to most meetups, "Great Places in Gotham" has a modest $1 organizing fee per event, payable to me at the start of an event, to offset the subscription cost of maintaining the meetup. Please be sure to read our policy about "no-shows" in the About section, so that we can all enjoy these great places with a minimum of discomfort.

Please note: Because we've been kept waiting in lobbies, etc., for folks who didn't bother to change their rsvps, Great Places in Gotham has a "no-show" policy, retroactive to February 22, 2009, where any member who incurs ONE no-show with no explanatory emails to me will be permanently removed from our membership rolls and not be allowed to rsvp for any more of our events. After all, would you keep a "friend" who stood you up and never apologized?

Like what you see about "Great Places in Gotham"? Then consider joining our sister groups also run by me, Friendly Native New Yorker Walking Tours (  http://www.meetup.com/Friendly-Native... ) , where as a licensed NYC tour guide I lead history tours the city, and my newest group, The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors (http://www.meetup.com/The-Mostly-Bay-Ridge-Neighbors-Meetup/), which focuses on Brooklyn, and Bay Ridge in particular.
results.name: The Great Places in Gotham Meetup

Meet other local Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers! Gather to network, exchange ideas, and socialize with others who are interested in writing about Sci-fi, fantasy, and other types of speculative fiction (SF)!

- Have your writing critiqued in a positive, supportive atmosphere.

- Get answers to your burning questions about writing.

- Share your own knowledge and insight with other aspiring writers.

- In the past we've had occasional guest speakers, including novelists and editors!

You can bring a work you want critiqued (such as a short story, novel chapter, synopsis, query letter, outline, or anything SF related). However, don't feel compelled to bring a story if you don't have one finished, as this is more than just a critique group.

We will also discuss the joys, triumphs, and just plain FUN of writing SF, as well as its occasional trials and tribulations. You can talk about favorite authors, characters (yours, or another author's), SF books, series, magazines, or even movies.

If you have burning questions about writing, or amazing insights about writing to share with other aspiring SF writers, bring those too! We want to know what works for you, what makes you more creative and productive, and share what can help us get published!

results.description:
WELCOME TO UNITED LATINO PROFESSIONALS!

Friends. Culture. Community.

EXPLORE THE CULTURE!

MAKE NEW FRIENDS!

GIVE BACK!

AMIGOS. CULTURA. COMUNIDAD!

About United Latino Professionals

United Latino Professionals (ULP Network™) was founded as a social networking group in December of 2008 with the original purpose of bringing professional people of like mind together to enjoy socio-cultural events and gatherings around Latino/Hispanic culture themes, expand their social network among Latino/Hispanic professionals, and give back to the community via volunteer opportunities and other community outreach events. Since its inception ULP Network has grown to include more than 5 thousand members globally primarily in the NY tri-state area, San Diego California and Washington, DC, with more members added daily, and local chapters being formed every year. ULP Network has a strong social media presence on all major platforms.

ULP Vision

United Latino Professionals (ULP Network™) is the leading social networking group in the nation for Latino professionals and those seeking to connect with our cultures and people. With chapters in all major urban areas in the United States and abroad, our activities will continue to unite people, provide education, and celebrate all aspects of Latino culture. ULP’s website social media channels, and digital presence is a respected, popular source of intellectually stimulating information, opinion, entertainment, education, culture and community programming for a wide audience.

ULP Mission

United Latino Professionals (ULP Network™) is a social networking platform designed to foster strong connections between its members, unite the professional community, and support the arts, culture, and education. Through its three pillars: Friendship, culture, and community, ULP offers varied, high-quality programming that expands awareness of Latino culture, social issues relevant to the Latino/Hispanic community and supports philanthropic endeavors that advocate, promote or provide for the betterment of society as a whole.

ULP Events

ULP upholds a high standard of quality and strives to provide upscale events of Latino professionals and those that enjoy, or wish embrace Latino culture themes and cultures.

ULP events are either planned and hosted directly by us, or held in collaboration with partner local or national organizations.  All events celebrate and/or raise consciousness about varying aspects of Latino peoples and cultures. Events all foster the development of strong bonds among members/attendees and between ULP and the community. They include social gatherings like dinner, brunch, happy hours, dance parties, wine tastings, music and cultural events and festivals focusing on art, theatre, film music, literature, panel discussions, community outreach and fundraising activities, all opportunities for networking.

* Non-Latinos are welcome to join. We also attend or visit non-Latino activities and venues as a group, looking to explore our great city and learn more about the diversity and cultures of the world, as we form part of a greater community of world citizens.


WE WELCOME YOUR IDEAS AND SUGGESTIONS.!

To join ULP Washington DC visit http://www.meetup.com/ULP-DC/

To join ULP San Diego visit http://www.meetup.com/ULP-SD/



Keywords: Community, business networking, cultural events, spanish, Hispanic Business owners, Latino, Latina, Latino Networking, Latino Culture, Latino Community, Latino MBAs, Latino Finance Professionals, Puerto Rican, Colombian, Ecuadorian, Dominican, Guatemalan, Venezuelan, designers, writters, non-profit, Argentina, Peruvian, Brazilian, Spanish, Uruguayan, Paraguayan, Panamanian, Chilean, Mexican, Honduran, Cuban, Latin America, puerto rican professionals, salsa dancing partners, latino professionals, Hispanic professionals, Latina professionals, Hispanic women networking, Latino networking, Latino meetup, NY Latino Professionals, Cuban professionals, Colombian professionals, Puerto Rican Professionals, Boricua professionals, Latino lawyers, Latina lawyers, Latina doctors, Latino doctors, Young latino professionals, wine tasting

results.description:
Formed in 1957, this year marks the 58th anniversary of the Mid-Atlantic Pilots Association, a non-profit flying organization dedicated to air safety, aviation education and flying camaraderie.

All levels of pilots, student pilots and aviation enthusiasts are invited to join. Meetings are held on the second Thursday of every month at Lincoln Park Aviation.  Meetings are free to dues paying members and their guests.  Dinner is no longer a part of the MAPA program.  Attendees are welcome and encouraged to gather at the Sunset Grill for Dinner and to socialize prior to or after the meeting.  Meetings start at 7PM.

Membership is $35 a year for certificated pilots who are granted full voting privileges.  For student pilots, who do not have voting privileges, membership is $25 a year. As networking is an important facet of the organization, we welcome the participation of all aviators to our fly-outs and to meaningful collaboration on events and issues of interest.

Click here to pay certificated pilots annual membership fees.
Click here to pay student pilots annual membership fees.

Fly-outs are usually held the Saturday after our meeting, but may occur earlier or later to coincide with a destination event.

For some helpful tips on using Meetup click on "more"  then "files"  and open the "Meetup how to" guide.

See you soon!
results.name: Mid-Atlantic Pilots Association

results.description:
WritersAnonymous is a writers social support group in New York City that was formally located in Boston, MA. When the group was in Boston, the members all pledged to write something ambitious and potentially life changing, and that was such a rewarding experience. We even wrote and published a book called "Seven At The Sevens," which is for sale on WritersAnonymous.org and Amazon. Also, if you do a Google search for "Seven At The Sevens," it's the first item that pops up! While there, you can also find our NPR interview about the book. Although we ended up publishing a book, the group’s main mission was about keeping each other’s writing going and on track, and holding each writer accountable to his/her own self-imposed but ambitious goals. The main purpose of WritersAnonymous.org was not about publishing a book or to have each other’s writings critiqued, although that can and did happen.

Further, WritersAnonymous is about being inspired by peers and inspiring others to find their own voices. It is about connecting with people who have a similar passion in life and who may understand you a little better because they have the same burning desire to tell a story in whatever written form it may emerge. It is also about forging new and lasting friendships in a supportive and encouraging environment during the often lonely and difficult creative writing process.

So, want to write and create something worthwhile, and also equally help others in their literary journeys? If so, join the group and let's begin!
results.name: WritersAnonymous (Not your typical writers group) Biweekly

results.description:
WHY FIGHT?... for 27 MILLION REASONS!

"Freedom is not a gift from heaven... we must fight for it every day!" ~ Simon Wiesenthal

Few people in the developed nations have a grasp of the magnitude of human trafficking. Fewer still take action. Welcome to Fight Slavery Now! Thank you for choosing to make a difference.

We are an all volunteer grass-roots organization of regular folks like yourself. Most of us initially knew little about this subject, or else believed that incidents were few and far away. But when we learned the truth, we knew we had to try to do something about it. We used Meetup.com to come together seeking a course of action. Though we are diverse in our backgrounds, outlooks and ages... we have become united in our outrage.

Founded at the end of 2008, we are still a fledgling group. This is a very exciting time to become involved as we are actively seeking new ideas and approaches as we continue to learn. Your participation will be highly valued. Additionally we are encouraged that the political climate has become somewhat more receptive, both locally and on the international stage, to addressing this debasing crime.

The sex trafficking industry overwhelmingly preys on young women and children. The slave labor markets rely on a ready supply of men and women fleeing desperate circumstance. Threats, trickery and false promises are the essential tools used by traffickers. Once under their control, victims find only abuse, humiliation, and endless exploitation. This is the face of modern-day slavery.

Because of its low visibility, too little is being done to combat this crime. Reliable statistics are scarce, but estimates run as high as 27 million people currently in some form of slave bondage. Not all trafficking is across borders. Many people are trafficked right here within the United States. Specific laws against Trafficking in Persons were formulated only in this decade, and in New York State only in 2007.

Meet other local people who are interested in the fight against modern-day slavery. Discuss how we can best educate ourselves and others, what actions individual citizens can take, and how we can join with others to end this abuse flourishing in our midst.

This movement needs all the help and all the talent it can muster. We need speakers and writers, doers and dreamers. We need wit and reason, passion and caring. People wise in the ways of politics. People with business savvy. People with organizing skills. We need artists and singers, poets and preachers. We need everyone who cares, all the men, women, and children who are willing to work to end slavery in our generation. We need YOU!

Learn more about human trafficking on our website: FightSlaveryNow.Org

Read more about this Meetup group on the page: "ABOUT US"
results.name: Fight Slavery Now!
