results.description:
Northern Manhattan Outside, or NoMO for short, is a group for New Yorkers to enjoy whatever gets us out into the great outdoors of Manhattan. NoMO is both a social group for northern Manhattanites and others to get together in a relaxed venue and an 'outdoors' group, for all New Yorkers who enjoy hiking, birdwatching, stargazing, kayaking, especially in and around northern Manhattan.
Many of the activities are designed to bring together northern Manhattan, New Jersey and Bronx neighbors to enjoy the parks and trails up here in Washington Heights, Inwood, the Bronx and Jersey. Other activities may include day hikes upstate in Harriman or Bear Mt. Park, a bald eagle watch on the Hudson in Manhattan, hiking in Cold Spring, bird watching, coyote watching in Central Park, excursions to Wave Hill, the Bronx Zoo, the Bronx Botanical Gardens or the Brooklyn Gardens (Hanami in the Spring!).

Both the area and the community of upper Manhattan are the main focus of this group, however all are most welcome!
results.name: Northern Manhattan Outside

results.description:
‘Connecting to Greatness - In Business. In Life.

Hi, I’m Kate Gaffin. I’m a lifelong entrepreneur and entrepreneurial energy is my absolute favorite kind. I created 'Connecting to Greatness' because I wanted to create a better, more rewarding and even fun networking experience.  And over the last couple of years, I've been invited to teach my style of Business Networking and 'Warm' Marketing to Diplomats at the British Consulate, Students and Alumni at Pace, Barnard and the Institute of Integrative Nutrition as well as to thousands of Small Business Owners and Entrepreneurs across the US.

~~~~~~~~

Featured on Fox Business News. Quoted in the Wall Street Journal

To read a story on Fox News about my brand of Networking and Business Building, please click below:

http://www.foxbusiness.com/personal-finance/2010/07/04/networking-heart/

Connecting to Greatness is a different kind of networking group. Instead of simply throwing people into a room with no focus or no common goal, we strive to enlighten professionals on how to network more effectively and build their business more authentically. We want our attendees walking away from our gatherings with insight on what to do with all the business cards they’ve collected and how to cultivate powerful alliances with those they meet. And we want to give our attendees the insights to grow the kind of business success they’ve always dreamed of.

In 2015, Connecting to Greatness will host an event every two to three weeks. Some events will be ‘mix and mingles' with some kind of structured activity as its focal point. We will also be repeating our very popular Gallery Wine and Dessert events. Other events will have presentations given by inspiring leaders in the world of success building and I myself will give repeat presentations on my most popular topics from last year. Occasionally, we will also run our ‘Speed Networking for Professionals’ events as these highly structured gatherings can be VERY productive ways to make new connections…when certain techniques are used to make them so. These techniques are shared at the events.

Finally, we will continue to host our very popular ALWAYS Sold Out, 'Bagels and Business' morning events.

Come out and join us at our next Connecting to Greatness event. We attract a wonderful and inspiring group of NYC area professionals. I look forward to meeting you!

Warm Regards,

Kate Gaffin

'Connecting to Greatness' - Inspired Business Networking

&

'Bagels and Business'

~~~~~~~~~~~~

Caramel Club is an elite introduction and networking service for distinguished people of color. The target market for this upscale service is professional people from various industries. This organization was founded because we believe that this population has been a neglected one in regards to networking services and events. The mission at Caramel Club is to provide a vehicle for upwardly mobile people to network for both business and pleasure. Through quality venues and a specialized website, Caramel Club is dedicated to building long term relationships with its customers. Our goal is to inspire steady expansion and the retention of customers by consistently supplying this niche market with ever changing networking services.  
Caramel Club will host exclusive events and offer optimum opportunities for 
our members. Caramel Club will allow members to connect, reconnect and interact more effectively with like-minded individuals who share social circles, interests, and schedules. Caramel Club has deliberately high standards and operates a policy of approving only genuinely suitable bios, and will strive to provide a balance of high-end professionals peppered with leaders and upcoming leaders from artistic, political and social arenas. We have imposed certain criteria in order to keep the network exclusive. To join Caramel Club, 
you will need to be invited by a trusted member. If you have not received an invitation, you can ask your friends to recommend you. If your friends are not members, you can submit your bio for our in depth vetting process.

results.description:
Welcome! As the Organizer of this group I would like to welcome you to the group.

We are in the process of re-envisoning and dreaming. Please bear with us.

If you are new to New York City and New Jersey, we know how hard it can be to settle in. If you are from the area but have been away for some time and now are back, and want to reconnect, please join us. 

We humans are hardwired for connection. We are social, relational creatures. We, however, are not born intimate. However, take heart, this is a learnable skill. NYC can be a hard place to find real intimacy and to be vulnerable. 
 
The goal of this group is to build intimacy. How we do this with be functional through our events.
 
Thanks,
Jaewan, Organizer


Please take the time to read over our general rules and guidelines.

General Rules and Guidelines:

Honor your RSVPs - Please remember that organizers have an obligation to fulfill and things get really complicated and your no-show may affect our reputation and future arrangements and accommodations at certain facilities, businesses and establishments that we have partnered with. Please note that repeated no-shows and late comers may be banned.

Although this group is designed to meet new people in an open environment, we feel strongly about the safety and the wellness of our members. If there is anyone, a man or a woman, violates that, we will ban that person immediately. And if you feel that a member is making unwanted advances after you have told them to stop, please let your organizers know and we will take immediate action.

Thanks for your cooperation.

results.description:
You are a spirit with a body, and not a body with a spirit. You may be in the physical world, but not of it. This Meetup is for people of many different backgrounds and beliefs. It's for anyone who feels there is more than just their physical world and existence. This Meetup is not promoting any particular dogmas or outer beliefs. It's clarifying one's own spiritul being and bringing this out in their outer world. 

This is practical metaphysics. it's a series of spiritual development meetings to unfold the good, kind loving being you are. It's going beyond the intellectual information to knowing this from within. The more you clarify and do what you are here to do, the more you experience being fulfilled. 

This Meetup is associated with similar Meetups being held in many cites. results.description:
Very few people in this world are born with the innate ability to control their reactive behavior. For most of us it is a learned skill that can take a life time to achieve. Not all get there.

Never the less it is in the hands of each and every one of us to do our fullest to reach that goal of going beyond our animal nature (the reactive state or thalamic response) to become fully human.

It's an evolution an education that we are talking about. We have the soul, we have the hardware, are we willing to use it? If we get there, become fully human in the spiritual as well as physiological sense (that we use all the higher functions of our bodies) then we also have the responsibility to share this wisdom with others. Analogy: what good is a cell phone if you're the only one who has one?

To drive this program we must have hope and the will power to go against all the nay sayers. It can be a strong headwind at times.

results.description: What We Do: "Helping Hands - New York" is dedicated to assisting Friends in Need Foundation, Inc. which is a non-profit charitable organization whose purpose is to help the less fortunate by providing food, clothing, and wellness programs, as well as working with other organizations dedicated to ending or minimizing hunger and hardship in our community. In addition, we donate food and volunteer time to established shelters and soup kitchens in need of financial and human resources. We also help Friends in Need distribute warm clothing and accessories during the cold winter months and offer assistance to families through our Family Support Program. The feeding programs were initiated in New York City, Newark, Philadelphia, and Miami. We now have regular programs in New York, New Jersey, Florida and Philadelphia. The organization, run by volunteers, continues to grow with complete dedication to our mission of helping those in need. results.description:
This is the Official Meetup Group for the BNI NYC Outer Boroughs Region.

The BNI NYC Outer Boroughs Region includes Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island, New York.  For more information, please visit www.bniouterboros.com.

Please note:  We DO NOT schedule periodic Meet-Ups, except for special events as we have WEEKLY chapter meetings in Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island that you can attend by arranging a visit to one of our Current chapters. 

 

Also, by joining our Meetup group DOES NOT make you a member of BNI.  By joining, you are only requesting to receive information regarding our chapters.

To become a member of a chapter, you must visit a local chapter and apply for membership.

To visit a current chapter and learn more about BNI, please visit www.bniouterboros.com.

 

About BNI:  Started in 1985, BNI is a business and professional networking organization that offers each member the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and referrals. With over 200,000 members in 6,000+ chapters in 50+ Countries, BNI is the world's largest, professional business networking and referral organization.

results.description:
DO YOU LIKE TO SHOP? Well who doesn’t! It’s unfortunate this economy isn’t very forgiving to our wallets because it also brings us so many deals and bargains.  So many sales, so little time…. What if there was a way to have 500 friends tell you which sale to go to? Guess what? THERE IS! 

TheVogueCity.com, the online lifestyle magazine catering to the bargain savvy New York woman is organizing now a Meetup club for the stylish gal on a budget.

Our online magazine provides its members and readers with un-sponsored bargain news, a constantly updated calendar of sample sales, editorial content, advice on how to put together trendy outfits from items on sale, reviews of well priced restaurants and free cultural events.  We have now decided to “kick it up a notch” and expand our online experience to a real one.  While we report and review a large number of sample and retail sales, we feel that creating a bargain connoisseur COMMUNITY  will empower us all, make us better shoppers, and give us the opportunity to mingle and have fun in the process.

We are the leading association for Real Estate Investors in New York City.

We meet the second Wednesday of every month at the New Yorker Hotel in Manhattan and we also hold Saturday seminars on different topics important to Real Estate investors of all experience levels.

results.description:
For more information about service and this group visit my page /log

-http://www.askthecognitivebehaviortherapist.wordpress.com/ 

-http://www.askthecbt.com

This group is about educating health professionals &  non health pros on Cognitive Behavior Therapy & Biofeedback:  how it can directly impact one's life by providing symptom resolution (anxiety, depression, procrastination, pain, insomnia, phobias, body image concerns, relationship problems, etc), as well as how you can use CBT daily to live a fuller more postive life with an enhanced sense of happiness, content and overall well being. Cognitive therapy goes BEYOND just fixing a problem, it can help you permanently change your style of thinking and thus your way of behaving to help you be the BEST you can be! 

About the founder: Dr. Jayme Renee Albin received her Ph. D in Clinical and Health Psychology from Albert Einstein College of Medicine /Yeshiva University in 2007 and her Masters in Development Psychology from Columbia University in 2000. She has been practicing CBT since 2001, has appeared on National Television as a Behavior Expert and been published extensively on various topics
results.name: Ask the Cognitive Behavior Therapist

results.description:
ABOUT THE NY CITY MOVIE WATCHERS & MUCH MORE MEETUP GROUP

Join our group to meet other local movie fans! Get together to plan movie outings and discuss hot movies of the month. We will go to local movie theaters to watch movies, and head to local restaurant, bars and coffee houses afterwards to meet, mingle and discuss. We are a fun and exciting group of people that love movies. We discuss the films we watch over drinks or a nice meal.  We love to meet and socialize with new and old friends.

Your Organizer: Milton Sandoval, sandoval.milton8@gmail.com

Any suggestions for movies or events are always welcome with a smile :) Just drop me an email!


OUR MOVIE NIGHTS

Our movie nights are truly fun and provide you with a comfortable and enjoyable atmosphere that allows you to meet and socialize with other movie fans like you. If you RSVPed for the movie you MUST come to the activity we have planned afterwards, we don't want people to come just for the movie, we want people who want to come to the movie, have a great night and make new friends.

Most common reasons to join this group:

1- "Hate going to the movies alone"

2- "I love movies and make friends"

3- "I love talking about movies"

This is why you must come to the mix and mingle afterwards, and why the $3.00 will only be refunded to those attending the whole event: movie & dinner.


MEMBERSHIP DUES

We require a one time $3.00 payment to join this group. This is not a money generating group so this $3.00 (membership dues) helps to keeps this group running, this helps pay for meetup fees.


WHAT MOVIES AND WHERE DO WE GO?

We watch all kinds of movies: mainstream, indie, thriller, comedy, drama, foreign films (Spanish, French, etc with English subtitles), and anything interesting. Always know that I welcome your input and ideas. Please email me at sandoval.milton8@gmail.com with your suggestions!

We go all over the city, from the Lower to the Upper East and West Side, and everywhere in between. We want to experience different areas and different theaters.


WHAT ARE THE $16.00-24.00 FOR?

The $16.00 include your movie ticket and Meetup fees. When you RSVP 'YES' you will be asked to make an Amazon Payment for $16.00 for a regular movie, and $24.00 for an IMAX movie.  When you show up at the movie theater, find the organizer or assistant organizer in charge of the event. They will have your movie ticket. YOU DO NOT NEED TO PURCHASE A SEPERATE TICKET, THE $16.00/$24.00 FEE INCLUDES YOUR MOVIE TICKET.

If you can't find me (your organizer) or the assistant organizer in charge of the event call us on our cell which will be e-mailed to you previous to the event.

After the event concludes, $3 will be refunded to you via amazon.


REFUND RULES

* Full refund if Meetup is cancelled (no exceptions).

* No refund when you RSVPed but fail to attend:

For some events we have to limit the number of attendees due to the limited seating we are able to book. When you RSVPed you are taking a spot, a seat, a ticket. If you RSVPed and fail to attend, you are preventing someone else to come and have a blast. Someone else who might really wants to come and enjoy the event. So if you RSVPed for an event but have a change of plans, kindly change your RSVP status within 24 hours. This will allow others to change their plans also.

1st no-show: If you fail to do so, your name will be put on the blacklist (no-show list).

2nd no-show: We will kindly remove you from the group, because it is not fair to others... it's not fair to you! We keep track of no-shows.

Please also note that you lose every right for a refund when making an Amazon Payment. Also check each event individually for refund terms.


MEETUP RULES

All rules are common sense. Remember everybody there is looking to have a great time, so please:

* Be courteous

* Be open to conversations

* Respect others as you wish to be respected

* And most important: smile


ABOUT DINNER

Please be advised that you are responsible for all your expenses. Please bring enough cash to cover your check.


LASTLY, PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY

By using this website, you agree to these terms and conditions.

JOINING AND SIGNING UP FOR NY City Movie Watchers & Much More ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in this group’s activities. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge NY City Movie Watchers & Much More organizer and assistant organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any meetings or activities. The NY City Movie Watchers & Much More group’s organizer and his assistant organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to NY City Movie Watchers & Much More to use the photograph, video, or recording of me for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Hope to see many of you!

results.description:
Meet other locals to discuss Acupuncture, specifically KM style Acupuncture, and how it can help to maintain or increase health and wellness, decrease stress, lower or eliminate pain (acute, idiopathic, or chronic), and manage symptoms of chronic conditions for optimal health and quality of life. Specific meetups will address: 
*Moxibustion, cupping, gua sha/Kirik
*Mei Zen facial acupuncture.(Sometimes called "Acupuncture Face lift"). Meetup will discuss what it is, how it works, and what results can be expected. Meetup will include screening for suitability.
* Reflexes and what they means in KM Style. Members can participate in an evaluation of their personal reflexes, discuss why they may have them and see what it takes to change them. Those who may not want to be evaluated for the edification of the group may make  arrangements for a private reflex analysis at the end of the meetup, time permitting. 
*Gua Sha in the family. Gua Sha has been used successfully for centuries in the family to fight  the common cold, flu, and muscular aches and pains, just to name a few applications. It uses simple tools that are easily acquired, and it is easy to learn- although it may take a lifetime to master! ( You don't have to be a master to get good results and reap the health benefits for your family). It is time to introduce this simple yet profound technique to the American mainstream. This meetup group will attempt to do just that. We will also discuss possible legal pitfalls when using Gua Sha with children and the elderly and what you can do to prevent misunderstandings in your community.  This technique has many names in many countries, Gua Sha is but one name, another well known name is Kirik. Most people find it very pleasant and relaxing- somewhat on the level of a deep tissue massage. 
* Acupuncture and Western Medicine/ where does acupuncture fit in the big picture of your personal healthcare?
* Topical discussions of Acupuncture and the symptoms of: Acute or chronic injuries from sports and martial arts training, Diabetes, Hypertension, Low blood pressure, Insomnia, Lung problems, Thyroid issues, Sinus problems, Heart conditions, Low platelet count, Cancer, COPD,  Edema, Poor Circulation, Knee or Joint pain, Back Pain, Migraines and Headaches, Infertility, Stroke, Calf Pain or Spasms, Weight loss, Kidney disease, Cystic Fibrosis, Fatty Liver, Inflammation in the body,  Musclular Spasms, Substance Abuse Cessation (cigarrette, alcohol, controlled or illegal substances): or any topic brought up during the meetup. ( The proceeding list is by no means complete, topics will be discussed in the order that most participants are interested in, there may be multiple sessions per topic, or multiple topics per session- time  and interest permitting).
results.name: Spotted Tiger Acupuncture Meetup group

results.description:
This meet-up is for individuals who enjoy Christian fiction as well as Christian concerts and art exhibits.  If you fit into that category or you are just looking to explore what this genre has to offer, consider yourself invited.

We have been dormant for quite some time, however; with the advent of warm weather and sunny days, let us enjoy some time together with good books, music and art.  It may seem strange to start up the group during the summer months, however; with everyone's busy lives, I couldn't figure out a better time, so here we are!

I invite all member to be active participants and encourage you to share your adventures in reading etc. as it pertains to your walk and belief in Jesus Christ.  If you are someone who simply enjoys Christian fiction and the arts, you are not excluded. 

There will be changes to the group's page and I ask that you have patience as I try out new postings and ways of getting information to you.

This group is for enjoyment, education, and socializing.  Pressure and stress and not allowed.

results.description:
Hello, and thanks for taking the time to check out our Meetup group.

We like to think there is something in here for every mom or dad in Astoria!

  • None of your friends have kids of their own yet?  Attend some of our numerous meetups and make new friends for yourself in the neighborhood, and of course, new playmates for your little ones!
  • Need a recommendation for a pediatrician or babysitter?  Check out our message boards.
  • Work full time and can only meet on the weekend?  Many of us do too, so no problem!
  • Fortunate enough to stay at home and want to meet other parents that can meet during the week? You have plenty of company there too, in this group.
  • Don't see exactly want you want on the calendar?  Send any of the organizers an e-mail, or ask to host your own event at a time and place that works for you.

A couple of other bit of information:

  • We have no specific rules as to who should join, but most of our members are either expecting parents, or parents of babies, toddlers, and preschoolers.
  • There is a yearly $15 membership fee per family.


The membership in this group has swelled in the short time it has been around, without any marketing besides word of mouth.  We attribute this growth to the fact that it is full of really wonderful, friendly and diverse members.


We invite you to join today, and we look forward to meeting you.

All the best,
Laurie, Jorli, Gina, and Tracy
results.name: Moms and Dads of Astoria

results.description:
Dedicated to the exploration of Science, Science Fiction, Fantasy, Gaming, Movies (discussions & viewing), Comic Books, Anime, Manga, Suspense/Mystery/Thrillers, Creative Writing, guest speakers, special activity outings and all things genre. The Science Fiction Society of Northern NJ (SFSNNJ) sponsors discussion groups, book groups, a movie viewing group & movie discussion group, a comic book/anime/manga group, hosts guest speakers & special activity events (i.e. Meet & Greet Dinners) and gaming in local book stores/libraries/comic book/hobby stores involving Science, Science Fiction, Fantasy, Art, Movies and much more. Join our online forum on Yahoo or join us at one of the many local area bookstores, libraries, museums/historical sites, and other private locations for many great events.

Each month we explore a different theme, and each of our many moderators work very hard to select the best works that will entertain and challenge attendees.

* That's Science Fiction! presents movie classics, new releases, and some surprises.
* Face the Fiction spotlights various guests each month from Charlaine Harris to local authors, as well as special events/outings (Meet & Greet at restaurants, Gaming Day)
* Suspense Central discusses mysteries, suspense, thrillers from classic to current.
* Drawing A Crowd explores the comic book universe Golden Age to today.
* Themes of the Fantastic takes the monthly theme and discusses all aspects of genre and writing critique sessions.
* Modern Masters discusses the works of today's literary masters, as well as some classics authors.
* Films to Come tackles the world of cinema and all things entertainment - movies, TV and media tie-ins.
* Heroes and Rogues is our monthly gaming event.

Imagination lives at the SFSNNJ, and we welcome one and all to join us for one of the most social Genre clubs in the region!

No membership or meeting fees, no obligations or demands, our events are always free & always fun.
results.name: The Science Fiction Society of Northern New Jersey

results.description: Meet fellow Israeli-Wine Enthusiasts like you in a casual, easy-going and fun atmosphere! Come to our Metro New York City meetups to taste exciting Israeli wines - just great wines that overcome the sweet, sacramental wine stereotype.  We respect everyone and follow a simple rule -- don't mix Kosher with non-Kosher wines -- so all wines and foods are Kosher during a Kosher tasting. Non-Kosher tastings are marked with NK in the announcements.  Everyone is encouraged to voice his/her opinion about the wine - no right or wrong....  Our Panel include a few wine experts and a chef and we voice our opinion about each wine as well.  You will learn about noses and tastes, medium or full-bodies, elegant and robust, and about the winemaking process.  Find out about other Israeli wine related events. Everyone's welcome, from new bouquet-sniffers to educated connoisseurs, from all walks of life and from different backgrounds.

results.description:
Meet other anarcho-capitalists, market-anarchists, etc., for enjoyable lunches and other casual events.

Note that anarcho-capitalism is a radically free market system that favors the abundant wealth production, rapid technological development and high standards of living produced by capitalism. Other types of anarchism, e.g., voluntary socialism (monks making cheese) are harmless and kind of cute, but not our thing.

We are also pretty lazy about fighting the state. Reading books and arguing on the internet are the majority of what we do. The more productive AnCaps write articles once in a while. If you hear someone suggest trying to get rid of government with violence or political action, he is not an AnCap and you should be cautious about associating with him.

If you are interested in *discovering* anarcho-capitalism, may I suggest that you read any or all of the following:

  • Machinery of Freedom, by David D. Friedman (http://www.daviddfriedman.com/Libertarian/Machinery_of_Freedom/MofF_Contents.html)
  • Power and Market, by Murray N. Rothbard (http://mises.org/rothbard/mes.asp)
  • For a New Liberty (http://mises.org/rothbard/newlibertywhole.asp)
  • The New Libertarian Manifesto, by Samuel S. Konkin (http://flag.blackened.net/daver/anarchism/nlm/nlm.html)
results.name: The New York anarcho-capitalist meetup group

results.description:
Welcome to the Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga, Thai Massage & Drum Circle Events Meetup Group!

The purpose of this group is to inform you of Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga, Thai Massage, Reiki & Drum Circle Events that my company- The Dancing Path™ offers in NYC, Long Island and Costa Rica.

Our events are about connecting people as a community through various fun workshops and events in order have fun, build connection with yourself, with your community and to empower you to create, live & celebrate your best life. My organization is called The Dancing Path but the events are not limited to dance. They are geared towards helping you create and discover what makes you dance inside and out! There is usually never any dance, yoga, massage or reiki experience necessary. All levels and backgrounds are welcome. The dance events are improvisational in nature and do not include any choreography. Participants are guided to express themselves fully & find their own movement & flow!

 

The Dancing Path™ hosts top notch facilitators from around the world offering various events, workshops and trainings such as:

Transformational Dance, Yoga Trance Dance™, Contact Improv, Soul Motion™, Biodanza™, Drum CIrcles, Tamalpa Expressive Art Therapy Workshops, Dance & Expressive Art Therapy Workshops, Shamanism Workshops, Shiatsu Trainings, Reiki Trainings, Partner Yoga Workshops, Circus Yoga™ Workshops, Budokon Yoga™ Workshops,  Manifestation Workshops, Didgeridoo Workshops, How to play the Djembe Drum, Community Beach Parties and more! Basically anything that is unique and fun!

I have a gift for finding stellar, fun, unique events and facilitators and I love sharing them with the world!

Join the group and you can stay abreast of all the wonderful events!


For more info on the events visit the website- www.thedancingpath.com
If you have any questions feel free to contact me at thedancingpath@gmail.com

with love & gratitude,
Trinity
www.thedancingpath.com
thedancingpath@gmail.com


What some participants have shared about past workshops-

Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated dance celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience. Doug Larson

I feel like this is the best 7 hours I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. But knowing what I wanted to manifest. I'm leaving here feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced from me during the workshop in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart and further from my pain. What a wonderfully diverse and creative way to manifest out intentions!
Much Love & Thank You, M.D.
results.name: Transformational Dance, Drum Circles & Ecstatic Events - NYC

results.description:
East Coast Karting Endurance Races lets people along the East Coast know about a variety of "Arrive and Drive" Karting Endurance Races at various venues.  This LeMans style of Kart racing has been catching on over the past few years where several team members take turns driving fast, high powered karts during a race.  If you are an "A type" personality this is for you.

This is an easy way to get involved testing your road course driving skills in the fun and exciting sport of endurance karting.  The "Arrive and Drive" concept lets you enjoy the real thrill of racing without the high cost of owning your own vehicle.  It is an inexpensive way to get your "Racing Fix".  Get in the cockpit and experience the adrenaline rush of racing similarly prepared competitive vehicles.

Whether you are a veteran road racer or 1st time enthusiast looking for some adventure, there are a variety of competitive classes inside of each race which make it an intense experience.  You you can race with your own team of friends or we can get you together with other driving enthusiasts.  Most venues also offer racing schools for all types of skill levels as well as family racing classes.
results.name: East Coast Karting Endurance Races

results.description:
Gainfully Unemployed is a group of people who lost their jobs but not their lives. This group consists of people who proactively enrich their lives with knowledge, experiences, action, and just plain fun.  Learn more about us here:  http://vimeo.com/39087073

Gainfully Unemployeds seek jobs, company, events and resources. In this group, we share ideas about resumes, interview tips, employment opportunities and free to low cost activities around the city. Since we all live productive lives there is no way we can spend the entire day sending out resumes. Best of all, if you are here, you are surrounded by people who are just like you; people who support you, applaud you, and just can't wait to meet you!

One of this big goals of this group is to expose its members to options of things you can do with all that free time. That is to say, we might have an event which will be enjoyable in its own right but it is also a door being opened for you to do that again on your own. Whether it be a volunteer opportunity, a free movie or just a cool place in general to check we welcome your ideas. We require you to be contributor to the group and the best way to contribute is with ideas or more importantly with your presence. This group will be what you make it.

So let's make it the best it can possibly be and contribute in the following ways: Forum comments: Some of you might have seen the new forums that have replaces the old message boards. We need all members to contribute Meet up Suggestions: If you have a cool place you want to check out or an idea for what to do please share it.
results.name: Gainfully Unemployed

results.description:
New York City + African Dance Rhythms = African Soul Jam, the FUN side of Africa!

Are you a DANCE or MUSIC ENTHUSIASTS? Do you like African pop music or are curious to know more about it? Then come to our African Soul Jam Meetup events, where you can socialize and dance with other music enthusiasts who are friendly and international in styles.

Unfamiliar with modern African rhythms? Imagine beats that get your head nodding, your hips swaying, and your feet tapping, even if you don’t understand what the lyrics mean! New York City’s nightlife is vibrant and diverse, but African music is surprisingly lacking. African Soul Jam parties bring world-class African music to some of the city's trendy night spots. Our live DJs spin contemporary, great rhythms spanning the African continent, from Dakar to Madagascar, Cairo to Cape Town. We also feature occasional live performances.

At African Soul Jam, you will hear live DJs' seamless mix of upbeat tunes in Africa's popular genres, including Afrobeat, Soukous, Hiplife, Coupé-Décalé, Naija, Azonto, Bongo, Makossa, Kwaito, Azonto, Kolazouk, Mapouka & many more! You won't hear these rhythmic blends of great jams ANYWHERE ELSE in the city!

African Soul Jam is NOT a run-of-the-mill club gig. We are passionate about spreading a positive image of Africa, connecting like-minded music lovers, and having FUN in the process. You’ll be a good fit for our Meetup if you find yourself in at least ONE of the following categories:

    Love culture

    Want fun & a good time

    Equal-opportunity dancer

    Energetic and adventurous

    Enjoy Global dance vibes or World Music

    Like to socialize, make friends, or network

    Spontaneous, open-minded, or well-rounded

    Friend of Africa, non-African, or African Diaspora

    Want to get out of same-old, same-old & try a new thang!!

This is more than a party; it is a lifestyle, nice crowd, & great music!

Or you can simply Join our Email-List to be notified of our upcoming events
results.name: African Soul Jam ( A S J )

results.description:
ARE YOU A SPIRITUALLY MINDED PERSON? Do you find it difficult to find people of your own kind?

Would you want to belong to a community of like-minded individuals that can understand you?

You are not alone!

The purpose of this group is to allow you to socialize, network, make friends, and explore the world of spirituality together. For those of you who are single and are looking to date or be in a relationship with a conscious and spiritual person, then this group is a perfect way for you to meet your match.

Our group often runs interesting and insightful talks on various areas of spirituality, health, and personal development.

Members of this group also put a lot of importance on their health and well being, and are environmentally friendly as well.

 

THIS GROUP IS NOT AFFILIATED WITH, AND DOES NOT PROMOTE ANY RELIGION.

We don't consider conventional religion to be necessarily spiritual, and therefore do not advocate or promote, or engage in it in any way.

 

IN ORDER TO JOIN THIS GROUP YOU HAVE TO:

1. RESPECT YOUR BODY

Acknowledge that your body is a vehicle for spiritual experience. This includes having a proper nutrition, conducive to spiritual development. Eating organic and non genetically modified foods (gmos). Engaging in practices that bring PURIFICATION, HEALTH, and WELL-BEING.

2. BE ON A SPIRITUAL QUEST OR PATH

You need to have a strong interest in spirituality and self realization, and the desire to explore authentic spiritual teachings. Spirituality must be on a high priority level for you.

3. CARE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT

Be as environmentally friendly as possible. Buy local and organic. Reduce your carbon emissions.

Support sustainable agriculture, clean AIR and WATER...

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EACH MEMBER OF OUR MEETUP GETS A PROFESSIONAL COMPREHENSIVE NUMEROLOGY REPORT AS WELL AS A RELATIONSHIP COMPATIBILITY REPORT. THIS IS OFFERED AT A DISCOUNTED PRICE TO OUR MEMBERS.

Contact David, the organizer to find out more.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are into: Spirituality, Yoga, Meditation, Astrology, Tarot, Numerology, Buddhism, Kabbalah, Mystisicm, Non-Duality, Healthy Natural, Organic Nutrition, Homeopathy, Shamanism, Naturopathy, Caring for the Environment, Healing, Divination, Alternative or Holistic Medicine, Fasting, and the like.... Then this group is for YOU!
results.name: SPIRITUAL FRIENDS - Friendship, Romance & Spirituality

This meetup group is for anyone interested in improving their presentation skills, as well as learning how to use visuals and assorted tools (PowerPoint, flip charts, objects) to effectively design and deliver powerful presentations.

Whether you’re a presenter, facilitator, designer, leader, or anyone interested in designing and delivering better presentations, this meetup is for you.

We'll address various topics related to presentations and communication in general, and also build skills to help take our presentations to the next level.  (For the record, I’m a presentation skills coach and learning & development specialist.)

Ultimately, we can all be part a movement to rid the world of boring, ineffective, presentations and hideous PowerPoint.  So join our community of evangelists for better presentations...!

Thank you… Steve

 

Tip: A great starting point for anyone interested in creating better PowerPoint presentations are the books “Presentation Zen” and “Slide:ology” (and their accompanying blogs).

results.description: The Catholic Fellowship of Long Island - The Catholic Fellowship of Long Island serves Catholic Young Adults in their 20's, 30's and 40's who reside in Nassau and Suffolk counties. In the Diocese of Rockville Centre, the group has a base at The Newman Catholic Parish of LIU Post Long Island University [http://liupostcatholic.org/], at St. Aidan's Parish in East Williston Park [http://www.staidanparish.org/], and at St. Paul the Apostle in Brookville.  The Catholic Fellowship of Long Island is a satellite branch of the The Catholic Fellowship of NYC, which currently serves as the Catholic Young Adult (CYA) group of two NYC parishes serving professionals in their 20s, 30s, and 40s. In the Archdiocese of New York, we are affiliated with St. Patrick's Old Cathedral in the Little Italy neighborhood of Manhattan (please click here to learn more: http://www.oldcathedral.org/cya.php). In the Diocese of Brooklyn, we are affiliated with Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church in Astoria, Queens (please click here to learn more: http://www.mountcarmelastoria.org/). We welcome everyone. Our events being social, spiritual, and community oriented are intended to be fun and inspiring. We hope that people take away a deep sense of camaraderie and unity as we seek to be the bridge to create new friendships and good connections. Most importantly, we also hope that people leave each event being touched by the Holy Spirit. Please also visit us at our main website at at http://www.cfnetwork.org/. We encourage you to come out and get to know us. Keep posted for our events.
results.name: The Catholic Fellowship of Long Island

results.description:
SPIRITUAL PEOPLE FROM ALL BACKGROUNDS, COME JOIN US


In our group... we read and seek to understand more fully the concepts portrayed in The Urantia Book (Urantia being another word for the Earth). The book is a collection of 196 papers that its authors say is a divine revelation to our planet. The revelators assert that they are non-physical beings, ranging from those divine in origin to those closer to the level of human beings, such as angels. How the papers came to be transmitted into written form is not completely known.The papers started to be collected in the 1930s and were first published as The Urantia Book in 1955. We read sequentially through the book, stopping as people have comments or questions, and we are able to experience together the book's life-affirming message of Sonship with God, as well as the wealth of details on such subjects as: the possibilities that exist for an individual after physical death; what the soul is; how life developed on earth over time; a description of the various orders of divine and semi-divine beings; and a year-by-year account of the life and teachings of Jesus of Nazareth, also referred to in the book as the Creator Son of our local universe.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This Group meets at CAP Studios located at 18 West 18th Street. This is a free study group . Meet other locals to discuss your spiritual path. Share your most profound and transformational personal experiences and talk about ways to incorporate spirituality into your life. Open to people of all faiths and cultures!

Attend the Urantia Midtown NYC Study Group which meets the First and Third Sundays of every month promptly at 12:00PM and continues to 1:45 PM. Join Us!
results.name: Urantia Midtown NYC Study Group

results.description:
Singles who are over 55 are a largely neglected demographic here on Meetup and in the world generally. It is difficult for them to find social events where they can meet other singles their age.  Though I am comfortable in and enjoy social groups with a broad age range, I realized that some of my friends, especially friends older than me, wanted a group that was more their own age. I decided to see if I could fill that need.

The idea is to have happy hours, dinners, museum visits, dances, movie nights, game nights, etc. where active men and women can meet each other for fun events in no-pressure situations, where friendship and romance can blossom! If you are a Baby Boomer or older, this is the group for you.

PLEASE POST A PERSONAL PHOTO (no sunglasses please!) WHEN YOU JOIN AND ANSWER THE QUESTIONS.  THIS IS A SOCIAL GROUP, AND AN UNANSWERED QUESTIONNAIRE WITH NO PHOTO, OR A PHOTO OF A FLOWER OR PET, IS NOT VERY SOCIAL!  PLEASE COOPERATE.  THANKS.

results.description:
Are you a fan of British telly, both current and past?  Can you not get enough of British films?  Then this meetup is for you!

Member interests in British film and telly are wide and include: comedy, sci-fi, fantasy, drama, period drama, detective, mystery & crime, documentary, war, action, cult, classics, etc.  We've watched older stuff like Blake's 7 and Upstairs, Downstairs.  We also follow some of the new stuff like Sherlock and Downton Abbey.  (I am not as familiar with Coronation Street, Eastenders, and other soaps though.)

Members have good collections of British miniseries and some other genres.  Series such as Tales of the Unexpected, Rumpole of the Bailey, Fawlty Towers, and Blackadder sit on my shelves next to The Forsyte Saga, Poldark, and I, Claudius.  I also have some entries from Play of the Month and other items of interest. Members are encouraged to make viewing suggestions from their own collections as well.  We have started a group database of our viewing assets that is visible to members.  I would like to revive the previous tradition of home viewing parties or come up with a viable substitute.

You will need a head-shot profile photo to be approved for membership.  Please read our Club Rules before applying, and come join us for a smashing good time!
results.name: British Film and Television Meetup Group

results.description:
We’re a discussion group with a focus on rationality, philosophy, science, technology, skepticism and ethics. We choose members who are friendly, intellectually curious, intelligent, non-religious, and rationally-minded – meaning that we’re more interested in figuring out the truth together than in proving ourselves right, or in arguing for the sake of arguing. Our members are young, almost all in the range of 20 to 35 years old.

Our meetings are usually informal group discussions at someone’s apartment, or occasionally in a bar or the park, with food and hangouts for several hours afterwards. Sometimes we also invite guest speakers – past guests include Columbia University bioethicist and author Jacob Appel; the co-founder of Givewell, Holden Karnofsky; the president of the Singularity Institute for Artificial Intelligence, Michael Vassar; and the A.I. researcher and rationality blogger Eliezer Yudkowsky.

To give you an idea of what our meetings tend to be about, here are a few representative examples:

Five Minute Lectures |  Everyone was invited to give an informal five-minute talk on a topic of their choice. Topics included evolutionary explanations for humor, measuring the entropy level of postmodern texts, and kung fu strategy.

Has rationality improved our lives? | Three group members volunteered to talk about whether, and how, learning the techniques of rational thinking had actually improved their lives.

Books that changed us |  Everyone was invited to talk about a book that changed his or her way of thinking.

Movie screening: Jesus Camp | We made popcorn and watched the documentary “Jesus Camp.” Afterwards, several group members talked about growing up in extremely religious families, what it was like, and how they shed their faith.

If you think you might be a good fit for our group, please click here to fill out a brief form introducing yourself to us. We're looking forward to hearing from you!
results.name: Ergo: discussions about rationality, philosophy and science

results.description: Few other cities boast the diverse array of ethnic enclaves and confluence of global cultures that New Yorkers routinely enjoy. results.description:
The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots was founded on April 15th, 2009. On that day over 600 disgruntled residents joined together for Nassau County’s first official Tea Parties in Hicksville and Massapequa, NY.
We are non-partisan and do not support any political party. We will support candidates from any party that shares our views. We welcome all new members regardless of the town you reside.

With few exceptions we hold our meetings the first Tuesday of the month at The American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. Meetings run from 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM. We encourage you to attend and to bring a friend. All of our meetings are open to the public.

Mission Statement and Core Values
The impetus for the Tea Party movement is excessive government spending and taxation. Our mission is to attract, educate, organize, and mobilize our fellow citizens to secure public policy consistent with our three core values of Fiscal Responsibility, Constitutionally Limited Government and Free Markets.

Core Values:
• Fiscal Responsibility
• Constitutionally Limited Government
• Free Markets


Our Philosophy:
The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots as an organization believes in the Fiscal Responsibility, Constitutionally Limited Government, and Free Markets. We are a non-partisan grassroots organization of individuals united by our core values derived from the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution of the United States of America and the Bill Of Rights as explained in the Federalist Papers. We recognize and support the strength of grassroots organization powered by activism and civic responsibility at a local level. We hold that the United States is a republic conceived by its architects as a nation whose people were granted “unalienable rights” by our Creator. Chiefly among these are the rights to “life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.” The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots stand with our founders, as heirs to the republic, to claim our rights and duties which preserve their legacy and our own. We hold, as did the founders, that there exists an inherent benefit to our country when private property and prosperity are secured by natural law and the rights of the individual


Real Time US National Debt Clock
http://www.usdebtclock.org/index.html
results.name: INDIVIDUALS UNITED FOR FREEDOM-A branch of the RVC TEA PARTY

results.description:
This is the place for art and figure drawing in New York from the nude model! This is one of the largest and oldest figure drawing groups on Meetup, and an extension of a figure drawing group that started about 20 years ago! Our goal is to offer artists of all levels, from total beginners to seasoned pros, an opportunity to draw from some of the best models, at the most modest of prices.

We offer several different kind of figure drawing events, so there's something for everyone. 

• Our regular figure drawing meetups, are traditional academic figure drawing sessions, usually about three hours long that feature one professional nude art model offering long and short poses in a quiet, relaxed atmosphere. These are friendly, non-judgmental events where you can work at your own pace. These have no instructor (but I'm always happy to answer questions). Events at our midtown location are open to all ages, our downtown location is 21 and over (ID is required).

• Draw-mania! is our monthly extravaganza--a four-hour draw-a-thon and variety show in a tiki bar! Every third Thursday of the month, you can expect four outstanding art models, a terrific DJ offering music that is conducive and inspiring to artistic creation (at least for most artists), and cutting edge music, comedy and performance art interspersed throughout the night. And if all of that doesn't inspire you, We're located in NYC's most fun and eclectic tiki bars, where you can find colorful and tasty drinkable inspiration! This event is strictly 21 and over, and ID is required. (While you are welcome to enjoy the bartender's creations, there is no requirement to indulge and beverages are not included in the entry price).

• Jerry's Draw-mania! is a weekly 2-hour figure drawing event hosted by Jerry's Palette Shop in Manhattan. It's features one non-nude model in long and short poses. Since it's in one of the top art stores, you have the option of purchasing materials at the event if you need them. At only FIVE DOLLARS per session, it's one of the best deals in the art world! These events are one of our few non-nude events, and are open to all ages.

• We also have special events throughout the year, including short boat trips, classes and seminars with an instructor, and social gatherings where you can get to know your fellow artists.

• Occasionally we will feature events on our site that are not "our" events, but which may be of interest to our members. Most recently these have included the Art and Design High School Annual Draw-a-thon, and Michael Alan's Living Installation. (If you have an event you think our members may be interested in, please email me to be considered for inclusion).

All levels of artistic ability are welcome. Just bring your favorite art materials and your apatite for creativity!


Are you new, and not sure what kinds of art materials to chose? Look at this article:
http://nyfiguredrawing.blogspot.com/2011/10/what-materials-to-bring-for-your-first.html

Also check out the blog for fun & useful art and figure drawing articles:
http://nyfiguredrawing.blogspot.com/

Check out this primer on shading & depth in drawings:
http://nyfiguredrawing.blogspot.com/2010/11/drawing-in-3d.html

And if you're wondering about the value of a 30 second pose, read this:
http://nyfiguredrawing.blogspot.com/2009/03/what-good-is-30-second-pose.html

If you're an art model looking for gigs, check this out:
http://nyfiguredrawing.blogspot.com/2010/03/new-advice-for-models.html
results.name: Figure Drawing NYC--Summer Sketch Group and Draw-mania!

results.description:
The aim of this Meetup is to provide a forum where men and women can share and learn the views of others on the many ways in which gender roles have an impact on our lives. The goals of Feminists and Masculists ring hollow if by definition, they marginalize the concerns of the other gender. Despite all the changes to societal expectations for each gender in the past century, certain traditional patterns remain. Some of these traditions amplify innate differences, while others arguably represent the arbitrary effects of cultural conditioning. 

Topics: 
Gender in the News, Equal Pay, Sexual Harassment, Life Expectancy, Rape, Workplace Deaths, Dress Codes, Marriage and the Law, Parenthood, Overpopulation, Domestic Violence, Jewelry, Flowers, Sports, Violence, Androgyny, Dating, Money, Sexuality, Hetero & Homosexuality, Pornography, GLBT Rights, Reproductive Rights, Religion, Incarceration, Health Care, Child Care, Prostitution, The Military, Suicide, etc.

The ultimate goal of this Meetup will be to question gender roles - Why do they exist? Are they necessary? Should they be changed? What do fossil fuel depletion and overpopulation portend for the future of gender roles?
results.name: The New York City Gender Discussion Meetup

Connect and network with each other to further our projects. Communicate with each other to form a better bond in the industry. Create, produce and write original and entertaining television, film and digital content.

Ultimately we call ourselves BTF.  

I read a book the other day about the Endowment Effect:

In behavioral economics, the endowment effect (also known as divestiture aversion) is the hypothesis that people ascribe more value to things merely because they own them.[1]This is illustrated by the observation that people will tend to pay more to retain something they own than to obtain something owned by someone else—even when there is no cause for attachment, or even if the item was only obtained minutes ago.

For this reason BTF will grow off your paid membership and your contribution to its core pirnciples

Regards, 

Chess

results.description:
Jazzville, NJ is a group for jazz lovers to come together, forge new friendships and share their love of jazz at performance spaces all over NJ.

 

Our aim is to promote the rich diversity of live jazz available right here in the Garden State: talented local acts, hungry up-and-comers -- even many of the same Grammy-winning, world famous performers who play expensive, sold out shows just across the river in Manhattan often play to smaller, more intimate -not to mention less expensive- venues right here in our own backyard.

 

While most of the events we attend are at venues between Bergen and Middlesex counties, we have scheduled meetups as far south as Cape May and as far west as Philadelphia. A few times, we've even made a pilgrimage to the Newport Jazz Festival in Rhode Island. Hey, sometimes a great show is worth a bit of a trek!

 

As far as jazz styles, we attend events from almost every branch of the jazz family tree, including swing, bebop, Ragtime, hot jazz, Dixieland, Latin jazz, jump blues, gypsy jazz, even jazz poetry in the style of Gil Scott Heron, Amiri Baraka or Robert Pinsky... Pretty much any style with the exceptions of smooth jazz and fusion. (i.e. Kenny G, Dave Koz, David Sanborn or the now-defunct CD 101.9 FM) (Sorry to exclude you smooth jazz lovers, but I don't want you to be disappointed.)

 

So if you're a pre 1970's jazz lover, I hope you'll join us in exploring the many sights, styles and sounds of jazz in NJ!


peace and jazz,

D.A.

P.S. A NOTE ON SELF-PROMOTION for club owners, promoters, musicians, etc:

While we appreciate event suggestions, if you wish to promote your own events, please attend a group event or two first. It's not only courteous, it makes good business sense to build up relationships with group members.

Become part of the group, contribute, show interest in other people's events, and I promise you, your marketing efforts won't seem like such an uphill battle. Please message me directly if you have any questions or if you are struggling with promoting your events.
results.name: Live, Old School Jazz with Jazzville, NJ!

We have a name for ourselves: “The Little Shul With A Big Heart” and we mean it.  A deep sense of community is at the spiritual center of our synagogue, a sense of searching together for truth and a commitment to tikkun alom, working as a unified group to “repair the world”.

Congregation Beth Ahm is a place where new ideas blend with old traditions, creating a harmony of contemporary Jewish observance and celebration. Beth Ahm differs from many other synagogues in its small size, lack of pretension and an overall feeling of warmth and commitment. These factors, combined with our dedicated and dynamic Rabbi, and our superbly talented Cantor make Congregation Beth Ahm a unique and special place.

We also have a wonderful Children's Jewish Learning Center where a low student-teacher ratio means that each child gets the attention he or she deserves.  By the time of their Bar/Mat Mitzvah, a student has been grounded in Jewish traditions and can feel comfortable  in any synagogue in the world.

results.description:
Explore a humanist community of freethinking people who focus on personal growth, social progress and compassionate relationships.

Maybe you're one of those people who sits in a church pew on Sundays thinking to themselves, "I don't believe this anymore." Or perhaps you've checked out of the dogma arguments altogether, avoid church or temple and just to try living a good, decent life. Or perhaps you’ve been living your own spirituality or philosophy, centered on this life and this world.

If any of those sound like you, we should meet! We're the Brooklyn Ethical Society, a community of individuals and families united by a belief in human worth. Founded in the 19th Century, Ethical Societies believe that bringing out the best in others brings out the best in themselves as well. We also believe in science, reason, humanity, and you.  We don't focus on an afterlife or Final Judgment: our duty is to the living, and to the future generations who will follow us.

We are a community of communities, with members from different traditions, backgrounds, races, family configurations and sexual orientations.

The Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture meets on Sunday at 11:00 a.m. from September to June.  Do you have children?  We also have an Ethics for Children program, for toddlers through teens, from 10:45 a.m. on those same Sundays.  We are at 53 Prospect Park West, in Park Slope, across from the park. We are also on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/EthicalCultureBrooklyn .

results.description:
Greenbrook Sanctuary is a member supported, secluded nature preserve.  Please write us with any questions or comments.

Palisades Nature Association/Greenbrook Sanctuary members in good standing receive approval to join our meetup group upon office confirmation.

Non-members of PNA/Greenbrook Sanctuary may join us via the link below. A key to the gate, provided with a PNA membership, is required for entrance to the sanctuary on most days when Greenbrook is not open for programs for the general public.

http://www.njpalisades.org/greenbrookMembership.html

PNA (Palisades Nature Association) is a non-profit org. of conservation-minded people, founded in 1946 to preserve the natural character of the Palisades cliffs and to develop a wild sanctuary in the Greenbrook area. Today it administers Greenbrook Sanctuary to provide a place within the metropolitan area where interested persons can study nature and relax in a peaceful undisturbed setting.

We have approximately 1,500 members and created this meetup group for an interactive experience. Members may post pictures taken in Greenbrook and get to know Naturalists and Board Members.

Rules & Responsibilities

To insure the safety of the members of the Palisades Nature Association and the preservation of the wildlife and natural character of Greenbrook Sanctuary, the following regulations (in addition to those of the Palisades Interstate Park Commission) have been authorized:

The Sanctuary is open to members dawn to dusk.

Automobile decal should be displayed and current membership card carried.

For their protection, members are to register at the bulletin board in the parking area.

Keys to the Sanctuary are not to be loaned.

Members should lock the gate upon entering and leaving.

NO pets are allowed in the Sanctuary.

NO bikes are allowed on the trails in the Sanctuary. They must be left in the parking area.

Snowshoes are permitted on trails, NO cross-country skis.

To prevent fires and litter, smoking is allowed only in the parking area and eating is allowed only in the picnic area.

Beach blankets and chairs are not permitted.

As guests in a sanctuary for wildlife, members must remain on marked trails only and must not remove or disturb plants or animals.

Members’ guests are welcome, but membership is urged if visits are repeated.

Family members under 17 years of age must be accompanied by an adult at all times.

ALL groups—school children, adults, or otherwise—must arrange for their trip to the Sanctuary through the Alpine office.

“Greenbrook Sanctuary is 165 acres of woodland on top of New Jersey’s magnificent Palisades. 4.7 miles north of the George Washington Bridge, off U.S. Route 9W, the sanctuary is an oasis of solitude and natural beauty, minutes away from one of the noisiest, most densely populated areas in the world. In the wildest, most secluded acres, trees rise 100 to 130 feet and are often over 200 years old. Awed hikers feel hundreds of miles and years away from the cities in such primeval forests”

The sanctuary is largely an oak forest, especially along the cliff edge where red oaks, hickory, and black birch dominate. In cooler, moister, more fertile coves, sugar maple, beech, dogwood, and tulip trees are common. Swampy, poorly drained areas are covered with red maple, sweet gum, elm, tupelo, hornbeam, pin oak, ash, and willow. Common shrubs are maple-leaf viburnum, witch hazel, laurel, blueberry, wild azalea, poison ivy, grape, and, in wet areas, spicebush.

Starting in early spring, before the trees produce their leaves, the sanctuary experiences a parade of colorful wildflowers springing up from the forest floor, and the fiddleheads of twenty species of native ferns uncoiling from the dead leaves. This paralleled in late summer and fall by an amazing variety of mushrooms, shelf fungi, and slime molds.

A five-acre pond with small adjoining bog increase the great diversity of this sanctuary. The 250-foot Greenbrook Falls is one of three major streams which drain the area and tumble down the ancient diabase cliffs into the Hudson River. Views of these waterfalls, the Palisades and Highlands to the north, and the densely populated cities across the Hudson, are possible from several promontories which look down 350 feet into the river.

250+ species of birds have been identified in the sanctuary.
Mammals include the nocturnal raccoon, red fox, striped skunk, gray squirrels, chipmunk, muskrat, cotton-tail rabbit, and the secretive white-footed mouse, short-tailed shrew, and common mole. Deer, opossums, weasels, flying squirrels, and red bats are also occasionally seen.

Each March, the pond, bog, and swamps fill with the egg masses of wood frogs and spotted salamanders. The dominant reptiles are eastern garter and northern water snakes, and painted and snapping turtles.
results.name: Greenbrook Nature Sanctuary

results.description: Please visit our website! www.bklyn.gd The idea of Green Drinks is simple, and universal: Gather together like-minded individuals, and talk. It’s as familiar as the local dive, completely organic, and a fertile scene for societal progress and the deployment of sustainable ideas. And it’s growing exponentially each month. This idea thrives here in Brooklyn, USA, thanks largely to a general warm, familial, progressive attitude. “BK” is also host to many of the country’s hippest hangouts, spread to all corners of this huge borough. At BKLYN Green Drinks, we’ll take full advantage of these defining Brooklyn traits as we chase down the blossoming Brooklyn sustainability scene. You’re an elemental part of this scene — and if you’ve ever chatted it up at a bar before, you’re a veteran at it, too. We have regulars from all parts of the city and visitors from across the country, from students to artists to NGOs, and they’ve all got interesting things to say. It’s free, fun, and as productive as you want it to be, so come have a chat and share an organic pint.
results.name: BKLYN Green Drinks

results.description:
En-LIGHTEN-ment need not be so serious...

Use your POWER TO CHOOSE to create your heaven on earth!

 

Our HOT and FUN workshops are interactive and playful--that's why we call them PLAYSHOPS!  We aim to provide you with a positive community and a delightful safe space to reconnect with your truth, trust your wisdom, honor your feminine, embrace your darkness, get inspired and feel whole with the awareness that you have what it takes to get yourself out of that rut and into a compassionate place of seeing your capabilities, what you really want, as well as what you can create in your life and relationships!


SEND IN THE CLOWN...
Learn to explore the serious and humorous perspectives of your situation! If you can laugh about your pain eventually, why not learn how you can laugh about it today? So your mom and/or dad flunked parenthood classes?  Have the men you've met been blah?  Does the job suck you dry?  What's a Goddess to do?! Let's start with a JOY JOURNAL to stay attuned to the pulse of the richness of what's good in your life and what you really desire.  Keep the nose on what you want to grow and keep the eyes on the road to NEXT!

 

PAINT YOUR POSSIBILITIES...

Because you can't move forward looking back, let's clear your emotional closet to free up blocked energy that needs to flow for better use, better health, and clearer understanding. Learn to heed your emotions as reliable guides in making decisions that honor your truth. The experts don't know it.  The fortune tellers can't see it.  Your fairy godmother is busy elsewhere...  Who's supposed to know what's right for you?  Only YOU hold that key to self knowledge!  You hold that magic wand of choice and commitment today!  Express what you are feeling on paper & take home powerful mementos to inspire!  Yes, you need not be an artist to paint your many possibilities!


CELEBRATE THE GODDESS IN YOU!
Own your Power to Choose and fire up your Inner Sexy!  Know exactly how you want to be loved and adored so you can teach others how to adore you, too!  None of us was born with an instruction manual and if there lives an expert to write yours, guess who that might be?! Understand how to make the most of what you've got, play on your strengths, highlight your charms to project confidence and self-worth NOW! You are a Powerful Goddess with unique gifts to bestow upon this earth. While you’re at it, be an irresistible magnet of all the right opportunities and people--not just Mr. Right!

 

"YES, YOU CHOOSE!" Playshops and Tele-classes featured monthly to serve your joy and courage.  JOIN US today to get connected with the wisdom within and without at our next powerful gathering!

 

At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into

a kaleidoscope of new possibilities. Jean Houston

 

Joyfully brought to you by: www.PowerfulGoddess.com
Celebrate Your Power to CHOOSE JOY!

results.description:
Esther DeCew A Performance Arts , Instructor & Choreographer currently based in New York City .Born and raised in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia, Half Malay Bugis Javanese and Borneo Sabah . Esther has devoted her life to dance was naturally drawn to mixing art forms to express who she is through performance and teaching.She was trained in the art of dance from the heart of her traditional culture.When Esther migrated to New York she looking for new inspiration , she formed a group of students who now preform professionally. In 2009 she established her own Dance troupe Oshedancer Multicultural Troupe.
Esther pulls from a strong dance background in Traditional Malaysia, Folk Dance, Javanese Dance , Modern Dance, Tribal Belly Dance, Salsa, Middle Eastern,  fire dance , and Hip Hop to create a colorful Asian fusion repertoire. .She has performed and taught inmany of the most popular Malaysian artists ,dance festivals,prestigious theaters, TV shows, tour concerts for Malaysia top Artist Siti Nurhaliza and travels around the world.
She has been working as a Performance dancer in Malaysia and Singapore for over 17years and is excited to bring her culture born from the oldest rain-forests on the planet and past down through her people for thousands of years to New York.
results.name: Traditional Malaysian Dance by Esther DeCew

results.description: Vital Switch presents meditation skills for modern people, a grounded and practical approach designed for people who live busy lives. Meditation is about being more. It gives you strength and centeredness to go beyond your limits. Beyond relaxation, this style of meditation raises the voltage of consciousness. Develop inner stillness and sharper awareness. Learn how not to get rocked by the waves around you. A key principle is see for yourself, know for yourself. The techniques lead to a development of vision that cuts through appearances and perceives the reality of the world and yourself. The meditation techniques that we use at Vital Switch are all from the techniques of the Clairvision School of meditation. The techniques are based on the principles of the third eye meditation in the book "Awakening The Third Eye" by Dr. Samuel Sagan - founder of the Clairvision School. This Meetup group is run by the New York-based wellness group, Vital Switch. Vital Switch offers a whole system of meditation which includes skills for stress relief and vitality management. The technique presented in the New York Meditation meetup will be one which helps to boost mental clarity and get you in touch with your life force. This is not based on any religion or dogma, rather it is a whole system of meditation skills that is developed for modern people who want to transform themselves. Ideal for anyone interested in learning a regular meditation practice. It is also good for those interested in awareness techniques they can apply at work or at home while going about their daily activities. The Vital Switch system will deliver stress relief, relief from burnout, help with chronic fatigue syndrome, improve mental clarity and alertness. It also offers tools for focusing at will, and methods to gain better sleep quality. The New York Meditation Meetup is designed to give people an introduction to meditation techniques that are designed for modern people with busy lives.
results.name: New York Meditation
